column2:
After climbing the slope of a huge crater we have faced an astonishing sight – down below we saw the remains of a facility. Clearly a man-made one. The dust didn’t manage to hide the rocket landing pads, the spherical concrete buildings and – what’s most disturbing – the large port-holes on the ground which resemble rocket silos too much to be sure.

<if(is_commander("politician"))>[<commander_profile>] You've heard rumors about Cold War military projects on Mars. It's intriguing, but it can also be quite dangerous.</if>
column3:
After climbing the slope of a huge crater we have faced an astonishing sight – down below we saw the remains of a facility. Clearly a man-made one. The dust didn’t manage to hide the rocket landing pads, the spherical concrete buildings and – what’s most disturbing – the large port-holes on the ground which resemble rocket silos too much to be sure.

<if(is_commander("politician"))>[<commander_profile>] You've heard rumors about Cold War military projects on Mars. It's intriguing, but it can also be quite dangerous.</if>

column2: The expedition was sent to investigate a spectrographic trace of rich metals deposit, but found something much more interesting – and troubling!
column3: The expedition was sent to investigate a spectrographic trace of rich metals deposit, but found something much more interesting – and troubling!
column4: Wysłano ekspedycję w celu zbadania spektrograficznych śladów bogatego złoża metali, ale twoi ludzie znaleźli coś o wiele ciekawszego – i niepokojącego!
Oddalcie się i zapomnijcie o tym.

column2: Leave the site, but upload its coordinates in the international database.
column3: Leave the site, but upload its coordinates in the international database.
column4: Opuśćcie to miejsce, ale wgrajcie jego współrzędne do międzynarodowej bazy danych.
Zbliżcie się do konstrukcji i zbadajcie je.

column2: We approached the mysterious facility with apprehension, but nothing bad happened. It appears that the location has been abandoned decades ago.
column3: We approached the mysterious facility with apprehension, but nothing bad happened. It appears that the location has been abandoned decades ago.
column4: Ostrożnie zbliżyliśmy się do tajemniczych konstrukcji, ale nic złego się nie stało. Wygląda na to, że obiekt został opuszczony wiele dziesięcioleci temu.

column2:
The facility has been picked almost clean, but there are still traces of evidence what happened here. People lived here, and research was conducted. The silos are empty, but there are signs that at least two of the five hosted nuclear devices. The labs are the most amazing part of the facility – most of the equipment and the computer systems were too heavy and unwieldy to be moved out of the planet.

<effect>A new Breakthrough tech has become available. The expedition will return shortly.
column3:
The facility has been picked almost clean, but there are still traces of evidence what happened here. People lived here, and research was conducted. The silos are empty, but there are signs that at least two of the five hosted nuclear devices. The labs are the most amazing part of the facility – most of the equipment and the computer systems were too heavy and unwieldy to be moved out of the planet.

<effect>A new Breakthrough tech has become available. The expedition will return shortly.

column2:
On the screen there is only a black silhouette. The person talks to you through a voice modulator.

"Commander, you've made  quite a mess by revealing the location of our facility. Now, we have to send a clean-up team, and it would cost us a lot of money and precious time. Of course, you can help us help you and do the dirty work yourself – remove all evidence that the facility you discovered ever existed. Your call."
column3:
On the screen there is only a black silhouette. The person talks to you through a voice modulator.

"Commander, you've made  quite a mess by revealing the location of our facility. Now, we have to send a clean-up team, and it would cost us a lot of money and precious time. Of course, you can help us help you and do the dirty work yourself – remove all evidence that the facility you discovered ever existed. Your call."

column2: The expedition team returns and you diligently and dutifully file in the report about the discovery. It’s not too long before you get the call.
column3: The expedition team returns and you diligently and dutifully file in the report about the discovery. It’s not too long before you get the call.
column4: Zespół ekspedycyjny wraca, a ty pilnie i przykładnie wypełniasz raport o jego odkryciu. Wkrótce potem ktoś nawiązuje połączenie.
Nie lubię, jak mi ktoś grozi!

column2: I will organize the clean-up immediately!
column3: I will organize the clean-up immediately!

column2: You have the strong feeling that the mysterious figure isn’t joking. Probably it would be best to organize a new flight to the facility coordinates immediately.
column3: You have the strong feeling that the mysterious figure isn’t joking. Probably it would be best to organize a new flight to the facility coordinates immediately.
column4: Masz nieprzeparte wrażenie, że tajemnicza postać nie żartuje. Chyba najlepiej będzie natychmiast przygotować kolejny lot do miejsca, w którym odkryto te konstrukcje.

column2: <goal>Return to the coordinates of the secret facility. Upon completion, you will receive <funding(reward_funding)> Funding.
column3: <goal>Return to the coordinates of the secret facility. Upon completion, you will receive <funding(reward_funding)> Funding.
column4: <goal>Wróć do miejsca, w którym odkryto tajny obiekt. Po zakończeniu prac otrzymasz <funding(reward_funding)> funduszy.

column2: Top-secret facility from the Cold War period. You have promised to wipe all evidence of its existence.
column3: Top-secret facility from the Cold War period. You have promised to wipe all evidence of its existence.
column4: Ściśle tajny obiekt z okresu zimnej wojny. Pamiętaj o swojej obietnicy usunięcia wszelkich śladów jego istnienia.

column2:
The ground is shaking and the people look in terror and uncertainty towards the horizon as the black columns of smoke quickly rise towards the bleak skies. You don’t need to look there to know what’s going on – the damage and casualty report says everything.

You can't shake the feeling that this is somehow related to the recent activities of your expedition team.

<effect>The punitive sabotage strike has destroyed <buildings_lost> buildings. <colonists_lost> colonists have died and <colonists_injured> have been injured.
column3:
The ground is shaking and the people look in terror and uncertainty towards the horizon as the black columns of smoke quickly rise towards the bleak skies. You don’t need to look there to know what’s going on – the damage and casualty report says everything.

You can't shake the feeling that this is somehow related to the recent activities of your expedition team.

<effect>The punitive sabotage strike has destroyed <buildings_lost> buildings. <colonists_lost> colonists have died and <colonists_injured> have been injured.

column2: Alarms follow the series of explosions throughout the colony.
column3: Alarms follow the series of explosions throughout the colony.
column4: W kolonii rozlega się seria wybuchów, której towarzyszy dźwięk licznych alarmów.

column2:
The mysterious stranger appears once more on the screen. You hear only two words this time: "Good job!"

<effect>You have received <funding(reward_funding)> Funding. The clean-up team will return shortly.
column3:
The mysterious stranger appears once more on the screen. You hear only two words this time: "Good job!"

<effect>You have received <funding(reward_funding)> Funding. The clean-up team will return shortly.

column2: The clean-up team has been instructed well about the operation goals and parameters. They act like professionals, and finish up quite quickly.
column3: The clean-up team has been instructed well about the operation goals and parameters. They act like professionals, and finish up quite quickly.
column4: Zespół likwidacyjny został dokładnie poinstruowany o celach i parametrach operacji. Działają jak prawdziwi zawodowcy i szybko kończą swoją pracę.

column2:
Accepting some refugees in the colony will generate both Funding and good press for us. Social transitions are never entirely smooth, though.

<hint>Refugees are untrained for life on Mars and will initially have reduced work performance at all jobs. Some of them may have trouble adjusting to the Martian lifestyle and may become Renegades.
column3:
Accepting some refugees in the colony will generate both Funding and good press for us. Social transitions are never entirely smooth, though.

<hint>Refugees are untrained for life on Mars and will initially have reduced work performance at all jobs. Some of them may have trouble adjusting to the Martian lifestyle and may become Renegades.

column2: Recent political turmoil on Earth has driven many refugees to seek shelter as far from the mother planet as possible.
column3: Recent political turmoil on Earth has driven many refugees to seek shelter as far from the mother planet as possible.
column4: Niedawne zamieszanie polityczne na Ziemi spowodowało, że wielu uchodźców szuka schronienia jak najdalej od ojczystej planety.

column2: We will grant asylum to some of the refugees.
column3: We will grant asylum to some of the refugees.

column2: Refugees from Earth want to join our colony.
column3: Refugees from Earth want to join our colony.
column4: Uchodźcy z Ziemi chcą zamieszkać w naszej kolonii.

column2: We will grant asylum to as many as we can.
column3: We will grant asylum to as many as we can.
column4: Udzielimy azylu tylu uchodźcom, ilu zdołamy.

column2: Refugees from Earth want to join our colony.
column3: Refugees from Earth want to join our colony.
column4: Uchodźcy z Ziemi chcą zamieszkać w naszej kolonii.

column2: <small_morale_penalty> Colonist Morale for the next <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols
column3: <small_morale_penalty> Colonist Morale for the next <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols
column4: <small_morale_penalty> do morale kolonistów na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_penalty_sols)>).

column2: Mars is not a place for untrained civilians.
column3: Mars is not a place for untrained civilians.
column4: Mars nie jest miejscem dla nieprzeszkolonych cywili.

column2: <morale_penalty> Colonist Morale for the next <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols
column3: <morale_penalty> Colonist Morale for the next <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols
column4: <morale_penalty> do morale kolonistów na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_penalty_sols)>).

column2: Let me make a tweet to distract the journalists!
column3: Let me make a tweet to distract the journalists!
column4: Napiszmy tweeta, żeby odwrócić uwagę dziennikarzy!

column2:
You waited too long to land the rocket and all of the refugees have died in orbit.

<effect>All Colonists lose <morale_penalty> Morale for <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols.
column3:
You waited too long to land the rocket and all of the refugees have died in orbit.

<effect>All Colonists lose <morale_penalty> Morale for <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols.

column2: The rocket carrying the refugees still floats in orbit around Mars but all the souls on board have been lost.
column3: The rocket carrying the refugees still floats in orbit around Mars but all the souls on board have been lost.
column4: Rakieta wioząca uchodźców nadal orbituje wokół Marsa, ale wszyscy jej pasażerowie stracili już życie.

column2: The Rocket has exploded just moments after igniting its engines. Sensor data report all systems were functioning within expected parameters. The evidence points to Renegade sabotage.
column3: The Rocket has exploded just moments after igniting its engines. Sensor data report all systems were functioning within expected parameters. The evidence points to Renegade sabotage.
column4: Rakieta eksplodowała w kilka chwil po włączeniu silników. Dane czujników informują, że wszystkie jej systemy działały zgodnie z oczekiwaniami. Dowody wskazują na sabotaż przeprowadzony przez renegatów.

column2: Dozens of red lights and alarms go off. Monitors stay frozen on the massive fireball that was our Rocket a second ago.
column3: Dozens of red lights and alarms go off. Monitors stay frozen on the massive fireball that was our Rocket a second ago.
column4: Na pulpicie zapala się mnóstwo czerwonych kontrolek, słychać liczne alarmy. Na monitorach widać nieruchomy obraz wielkiej kuli ognia, która sekundę wcześniej była jedną z naszych rakiet.

column2: The Renegades went too far this time...
column3: The Renegades went too far this time...
column4: Tym razem renegaci posunęli się za daleko...

column2:
Several Renegades have been pushed to their deaths during the night, in what seems like nothing short of an execution.

Just as you are about to begin coordinating a plan with the ranking Officers, a Colonist admits to being the culprit.

<DisplayName> says the murdered group of renegades had been tormenting youngsters left and right around the Domes - some of which had been pushed to suicide. 

When they saw that the authorities were not going to solve this problem, <DisplayName> decided to take matters into their own hands. They punished the predatory group of renegades and are now ready to accept their fate.
column3:
Several Renegades have been pushed to their deaths during the night, in what seems like nothing short of an execution.

Just as you are about to begin coordinating a plan with the ranking Officers, a Colonist admits to being the culprit.

<DisplayName> says the murdered group of renegades had been tormenting youngsters left and right around the Domes - some of which had been pushed to suicide. 

When they saw that the authorities were not going to solve this problem, <DisplayName> decided to take matters into their own hands. They punished the predatory group of renegades and are now ready to accept their fate.

column2: News of the gruesome crime have reached your ears with the sunrise.
column3: News of the gruesome crime have reached your ears with the sunrise.
column4: O świcie docierają do ciebie wieści o ponurej zbrodni.

column2: This is wrong and immoral. Prepare to ship <DisplayName> back to Earth.
column3: This is wrong and immoral. Prepare to ship <DisplayName> back to Earth.
column4: To jest złe i niemoralne. Niech <DisplayName> wraca na Ziemię.

column2: Maybe <DisplayName> is the antidote for our crime problem. Set them loose.
column3: Maybe <DisplayName> is the antidote for our crime problem. Set them loose.
column4: Może <DisplayName> jest lekarstwem na nasz problem z przestępczością? Wypuścić.

column2: They will tour all the different colonies on Mars and have got their own transportation covered. All RockScape's management needs from us is permission to play and to prepare a Dome for the event.
column3: Яны аб'едуць усе розныя калёніі на Марсе й забясьпечаць уласны транспарт. Усё
column4: Zespół odbędzie tournée po wszystkich koloniach na Marsie. Ma własne środki transportu i menedżer grupy potrzebuje od nas jedynie zezwolenia na występ i przygotowania kopuły na koncert.

column2: A famous rock band called RockScape wishes to bring their music to Mars for a live performance.
column3: Вядомая рок-група пад назвай RockScape жадае прывезьці сваю музыку на Марс для жывога выступу.
column4: Sławny zespół rockowy Imperfect chce dać serię występów na żywo na Marsie.

column2: all Colonists gain <morale_boost> Morale for <sols(moraleboost_period)> Sols
column3: Усе каляністы атрымліваюць <morale_boost> Маральнага духу на <sols(moraleboost_period)> Сол(ы)
column4: wszyscy koloniści otrzymują <morale_boost> morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(moraleboost_period)>).

column2: We have enough troubles. Don't rock the boat I say.
column3: Хапае ў нас бед. Не разгойдвайце лодку.
column4: Mamy dosyć własnych kłopotów. Lepiej nie bujać tą łodzią.

column2: We will need to prepare a Dome to withstand the noise levels an event like this suggests.
column3: Нам патрэбна будзе падрыхтаваць купал, каб ён вытрымліваў узровень шуму, які бывае на падобнай падзее.
column4: Musimy przygotować jakąś kopułę, aby wytrzymała poziom hałasu, jaki zwykle wiąże się z taką imprezą.

column2: all Colonists gain <morale_boost> Morale for <sols(moraleboost_period)> Sols
column3: Усе каляністы атрымліваюць <morale_boost> Маральнага духу на <sols(moraleboost_period)> Сол(ы)
column4: wszyscy koloniści otrzymują <morale_boost> morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(moraleboost_period)>).

column2:
It seems we hadn't properly estimated the noise levels and that even our Domes were not made to withstand the power of Rock and Roll.

<effect>The concert caused several fractures in the superstructure of the hosting Dome.
column3:
Здаецца, мы кепска ацанілі ўзровень шуму. Нашы купалы не былі зроблены, каб супрацьстаяць магутнасьці Rock'n'Roll'у.

<effect>Канцэрт стаў прычынай некалькіх шчылін надбудовы прымаючага Купалу.

column2: The concert was awesome - everyone had a blast but...
column3: Гэта быў цудоўны канцэрт - усе атрымалі задавальненьне, але...
column4: Koncert był fenomenalny – wszyscy mogli się wyżyć, ale...

column2: I guess we didn't think this through.
column3: Мяркую, што мы не прадумалі гэта.
column4: Chyba nie przemyśleliśmy tego do końca.

column2: We had to suspend the rocket launch due to suspicious atmospheric patterns. There is nothing wrong with the Rocket and it is now ready for launch again. However people are concerned - after all rockets are our only way back home.
column3: We had to suspend the rocket launch due to suspicious atmospheric patterns. There is nothing wrong with the Rocket and it is now ready for launch again. However people are concerned - after all rockets are our only way back home.
column4: Musieliśmy wstrzymać start rakiety z powodu niepomyślnej prognozy pogody. Z samą rakietą nic się nie dzieje, jest gotowa do ponownej próby startu. Jednak ludzie się martwią – w końcu rakiety są jedynym, co jeszcze nas łączy z domem.

column2: Several colonists have gathered to watch the launch. Their anticipation is quickly replaced by concern as the engines remain silent and the Rocket remains firmly on the ground.
column3: Several colonists have gathered to watch the launch. Their anticipation is quickly replaced by concern as the engines remain silent and the Rocket remains firmly on the ground.
column4: Kilkunastu kolonistów zebrało się w pobliżu platformy, by obserwować start. Ich oczekiwanie zmieniło się jednak w niepokój, gdyż silniki rakiety wciąż milczą, a ona sama nie rusza się z ziemi.

column2: You have my full assurance that everything is going to be alright.
column3: You have my full assurance that everything is going to be alright.
column4: Zapewniam z całkowitym przekonaniem, że wszystko będzie dobrze.

column2: Postponing rocket launches is a routine procedure, there's nothing to fear.
column3: Postponing rocket launches is a routine procedure, there's nothing to fear.
column4: Opóźnienie startu rakiety to rutynowa procedura, nie ma się czego obawiać.
<rocket_scientist_morale> do morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(rocket_scientist_morale_duration)>).

column2: We will do an additional maintenance check, just to alleviate the concerns.
column3: We will do an additional maintenance check, just to alleviate the concerns.
column4: Aby rozwiać wszelkie obawy, przeprowadzimy dodatkową kontrolę techniczną.

column2: If the experts are satisfied, this is good enough for me.
column3: If the experts are satisfied, this is good enough for me.
column4: Jeśli eksperci są zadowoleni, to mi wystarczy.
<morale> do morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_duration)>).

column2: <DisplayName> has failed to launch. We believe the problem lies within the ratio of liquid oxygen to liquid methane. We’ve compensated the issue but it is highly recommended to perform a full maintenance on the Rocket which will cost <machineparts(cost)>.
column3: <DisplayName> has failed to launch. We believe the problem lies within the ratio of liquid oxygen to liquid methane. We’ve compensated the issue but it is highly recommended to perform a full maintenance on the Rocket which will cost <machineparts(cost)>.
column4: Nie udało się wystrzelić rakiety <DisplayName>. Sądzimy, że przyczyną problemu jest stosunek tlenu do ciekłego metanu. Nieco to skompensowaliśmy, ale bardzo wskazane jest przeprowadzenie pełnej konserwacji rakiety, co będzie wymagać <machineparts(cost)>.

column2: Several Colonists have gathered to watch the launch. Their anticipation is quickly replaced by concern as the engines spit dust and smoke but the Rocket refuses to get off the ground.
column3: Several Colonists have gathered to watch the launch. Their anticipation is quickly replaced by concern as the engines spit dust and smoke but the Rocket refuses to get off the ground.
column4: Kilkunastu kolonistów zebrało się w pobliżu platformy, by obserwować start. Ich oczekiwanie zmieniło się jednak w niepokój, gdy silniki wypluły chmurę dymu i pyłu, a rakieta nie oderwała się od ziemi.

column2: I think the issue is software-related.
column3: I think the issue is software-related.
column4: Myślę, że to problem z oprogramowaniem.

column2: Launch the Rocket and repair it back on Earth.
column3: Launch the Rocket and repair it back on Earth.
column4: Wystrzelić rakietę i niech naprawią ją na Ziemi.

column2: The Rocket slowly begins to move towards the sky but something is not right. Just seconds later it is engulfed in flames and a bright fireball lights the sky.
column3: The Rocket slowly begins to move towards the sky but something is not right. Just seconds later it is engulfed in flames and a bright fireball lights the sky.
column4: Rakieta zaczyna unosić się powoli ku niebu, ale coś jest nie tak. Po zaledwie kilku sekundach ogarniają ją płomienie i niebo rozświetla wielka kula ognia.

column2:
We’ve lost rocket <DisplayName>. Fortunately there was no collateral damage but the entire payload was destroyed.

<effect><morale> Morale for the next <sols(morale_duration)> Sols.
column3:
We’ve lost rocket <DisplayName>. Fortunately there was no collateral damage but the entire payload was destroyed.

<effect><morale> Morale for the next <sols(morale_duration)> Sols.

column2: Troubling is, it seems Matthew's new “friend” knows about quantum physics a lot more than his age suggests.
column3: Troubling is, it seems Matthew's new “friend” knows about quantum physics a lot more than his age suggests.
column4: Dość niepokojące jest to, że najwyraźniej nowy „przyjaciel” Matthew wie o fizyce kwantowej dużo więcej, niż sugeruje jego wiek.

column2: A twelve-year-old boy living in the colony has an imaginary friend he calls Shocky.
column3: A twelve-year-old boy living in the colony has an imaginary friend he calls Shocky.
column4: Pewien dwunastoletni chłopiec z naszej kolonii ma wymyślonego przyjaciela imieniem Szokuś.

column2: Is that so? Summon three of our leading scientists and let them interview this boy.
column3: Is that so? Summon three of our leading scientists and let them interview this boy.
column4: Doprawdy? Wezwijcie trzech naszych najlepszych naukowców, niech porozmawiają z tym chłopcem.

column2: Intriguing. Take this boy from his parents and study him in a Research Lab.
column3: Intriguing. Take this boy from his parents and study him in a Дасьледчая лабараторыя.
column4: Intrygujące. Zabierzcie go rodzicom i zbadajcie w laboratorium badawczym.

column2: all Colonists lose Morale, gain Research
column3: all Colonists lose Morale, gain Research
column4: wszyscy koloniści tracą morale, uzyskujesz punkty badań.

column2: We should not meddle with a young person’s mind. Let him be.
column3: We should not meddle with a young person’s mind. Let him be.
column4: Nie powinniśmy igrać z młodym, rozwijającym się umysłem. Dajcie mu spokój.

column2: This boy has great potential. I will personally help him unfold it.
column3: This boy has great potential. I will personally help him unfold it.
column4: Ten chłopak ma wielki potencjał. Osobiście pomogę mu go rozwinąć.

column2:
However, after the initial frustration, they were quite astonished by the radical ideas of the boy.

<effect>Three Scientists lost Sanity.
column3:
However, after the initial frustration, they were quite astonished by the radical ideas of the boy.

<effect>Three Scientists lost Sanity.

column2: The scientists were confronted with new ideas which undermined the very foundations of modern Physics.
column3: The scientists were confronted with new ideas which undermined the very foundations of modern Physics.
column4: Chłopiec przedstawił naukowcom nowe idee, które podważają fundamenty nowoczesnej fizyki.

column2: Science is a process. Nothing is written in stone.
column3: Science is a process. Nothing is written in stone.
column4: Nauka to proces. Nic nie jest wyryte w kamieniu.

column2: 3 Scientist Colonists gain a high Morale boost
column3: 3 Scientist Colonists gain a high Morale boost
column4: 3 kolonistów-naukowców otrzymuje dużą premię do morale

column2: So a twelve-year-old knows more about the universe than our best Physicists?
column3: So a twelve-year-old knows more about the universe than our best Physicists?
column4: Zatem dwunastolatek wie o Wszechświecie więcej niż nasi najlepsi fizycy?

column2: all non-Scientist Colonists gain a small Morale boost
column3: all non-Scientist Colonists gain a small Morale boost
column4: wszyscy koloniści niebędący naukowcami otrzymują małą premię do morale.

column2:
The researchers came up with a confirmation of the theory that parallel universes exist and even though some of them are similar to ours, others are horrifying. The mind of <DisplayName> could not bear this knowledge.

<effect>3 Scientists lost Sanity. We gained 4000 Research.
column3:
The researchers came up with a confirmation of the theory that parallel universes exist and even though some of them are similar to ours, others are horrifying. The mind of <DisplayName> could not bear this knowledge.

<effect>3 Scientists lost Sanity. We gained 4000 Research.

column2: The boy who had an “imaginary friend” thrashes and speaks gibberish, restrained in the lab chair.
column3: The boy who had an “imaginary friend” thrashes and speaks gibberish, restrained in the lab chair.
column4: Chłopiec, który miał „wymyślonego przyjaciela”, załamuje się i bełkocze, przywiązany do krzesła laboratoryjnego.

column2: This is disturbing. Stop the project and send all data to our Sponsor.
column3: This is disturbing. Stop the project and send all data to our Sponsor.
column4: To niepokojące. Przerwać projekt i przesłać wszystkie dane do naszego sponsora.

column2: Everything is acceptable in the name of science. Continue the research!
column3: Everything is acceptable in the name of science. Continue the research!
column4: W imię nauki wszystko jest dopuszczalne. Kontynuować badania!

column2:
It seems that the “imaginary friend” of the boy wasn’t imaginary at all. While tried to establish contact with the parallel universe where it comes from, our scientists  somehow opened a portal to another dimension. However, it was unstable and horrible creatures have reached from it into our world. In a desperate attempt to save our reality, the head of the science team has opened the oxygen vents and triggered an explosion in the facility.

<effect>A new Breakthrough is available for research. Matthew Gore has perished.
column3:
It seems that the “imaginary friend” of the boy wasn’t imaginary at all. While tried to establish contact with the parallel universe where it comes from, our scientists  somehow opened a portal to another dimension. However, it was unstable and horrible creatures have reached from it into our world. In a desperate attempt to save our reality, the head of the science team has opened the oxygen vents and triggered an explosion in the facility.

<effect>A new Breakthrough is available for research. Matthew Gore has perished.

column2: Stranger things happened at the research facility.
column3: Stranger things happened at the research facility.
column4: W laboratoriach przytrafiają się dziwniejsze rzeczy.

column2: Science requires sacrifices. We shall name their discoveries after the boy - Matthew Gore!
column3: Science requires sacrifices. We shall name their discoveries after the boy - Matthew Gore!
column4: Nauka wymaga poświęceń. Upamiętnimy Matthew Gore'a, nadając jego nazwisko jakiemuś odkryciu naukowemu!

column2: many Colonists lose Morale, unlock some random Techs
column3: many Colonists lose Morale, unlock some random Techs
column4: wielu kolonistów traci morale, odblokowanych zostaje kilka technologii.

column2: There was a tragic accident at the Research Lab. We are still investigating the issue.
column3: There was a tragic accident at the Дасьледчая лабараторыя. We are still investigating the issue.
column4: Doszło do tragicznego wypadku w laboratorium badawczym. Nadal badamy przyczyny.

column2: Calm down. We will create a special committee to investigate this tragic event.
column3: Calm down. We will create a special committee to investigate this tragic event.
column4: Tylko spokojnie. Powołamy specjalną komisję do zbadania tego tragicznego wypadku.

column2:
Yet the mystic influence of Shocky marked him for life.

<effect>Matthew Gore has grown up as an Enthusiast Scientist.
column3:
Yet the mystic influence of Shocky marked him for life.

<effect>Matthew Gore has grown up as an Enthusiast Scientist.

column2: In time, the imaginary friend of Matthew seemed to disappear and he stopped talking about it. He grew up as a wonderful young man, fully dedicated to science.
column3: In time, the imaginary friend of Matthew seemed to disappear and he stopped talking about it. He grew up as a wonderful young man, fully dedicated to science.
column4: Z czasem wymyślony przyjaciel Matthew najwyraźniej zniknął, a chłopiec przestał o nim mówić. Wyrósł na wspaniałego młodego człowieka, całkowicie poświęconego nauce.

column2:
However, the mystic influence of Shocky somehow gifted him with an insight far beyond the normal people.

<effect>Matthew Gore has grown up as a Genius Scientist.
column3:
However, the mystic influence of Shocky somehow gifted him with an insight far beyond the normal people.

<effect>Matthew Gore has grown up as a Genius Scientist.

column2: Leaning on your professional expertise, you have managed to convince Matthew that Shocky doesn’t exist and in time he stopped talking about it. He grew up as a wonderful young man, fully dedicated to science.
column3: Leaning on your professional expertise, you have managed to convince Matthew that Shocky doesn’t exist and in time he stopped talking about it. He grew up as a wonderful young man, fully dedicated to science.
column4: Dzięki doświadczeniu zawodowemu udało ci się przekonać Matthew, że Szokuś nie istnieje, i z czasem chłopiec przestał o nim mówić. Wyrósł na wspaniałego młodego człowieka, całkowicie poświęconego nauce.

column2:
It turns out that <DisplayName> were secretly looking for a way to transfer their consciousness into an artificial body.

At least ten attempts were made to do so, ironically with the last attempt causing the death of the Colonist. While they couldn’t transfer their own consciousness into a better body they somehow managed to imprint both intelligence and self-awareness in the artificial hosts.

Unfortunately, <DisplayName> most probably thought their work was taboo and had all of their research destroyed before the attempts were made. We are currently not capable to replicate this result.

<effect>Receive 10 biorobot colonists in the dome. <DisplayName> has died.
column3:
It turns out that <DisplayName> were secretly looking for a way to transfer their consciousness into an artificial body.

At least ten attempts were made to do so, ironically with the last attempt causing the death of the Colonist. While they couldn’t transfer their own consciousness into a better body they somehow managed to imprint both intelligence and self-awareness in the artificial hosts.

Unfortunately, <DisplayName> most probably thought their work was taboo and had all of their research destroyed before the attempts were made. We are currently not capable to replicate this result.

<effect>Receive 10 biorobot colonists in the dome. <DisplayName> has died.

column2: You have received a report about the demise of one of the workers in our Biorobotic Workshops.
column3: You have received a report about the demise of one of the workers in our Biorobotic Workshops.
column4: Otrzymujesz raport o zgonie jednego z pracowników naszych pracowni biorobotów.

column2:
He needs to secure the lump sum of <funding(funding_cost)> in order to realize a "revolutionary instrument", designed to reveal the secrets of the Cosmos. 

Despite his impeccable reputation, however, the lack of direct monetary application for the technology has made securing the funds on Earth quite difficult.

When the prototype phase has been completed, he will share the blueprints for the device with us.
column3:
He needs to secure the lump sum of <funding(funding_cost)> in order to realize a "revolutionary instrument", designed to reveal the secrets of the Cosmos. 

Despite his impeccable reputation, however, the lack of direct monetary application for the technology has made securing the funds on Earth quite difficult.

When the prototype phase has been completed, he will share the blueprints for the device with us.

column2: Rayan Cox – an astrophysicist of some renown, has reached us with a proposition which he describes as being mutually beneficial.
column3: Rayan Cox – an astrophysicist of some renown, has reached us with a proposition which he describes as being mutually beneficial.
column4: Rayan Cox, dość znany astrofizyk, dotarł do nas z pewną propozycją, która jest według niego korzystna dla obu stron.

column2: We owe our very existence to such innovations. Secure the funds needed.
column3: We owe our very existence to such innovations. Secure the funds needed.
column4: Takie innowacje są gwarancją naszego przetrwania. Przekażcie potrzebne fundusze.

column2: Money, sadly, is also a tool in our survival playbook – a tool we need a lot.
column3: Money, sadly, is also a tool in our survival playbook – a tool we need a lot.
column4: Niestety, pieniądze są jednym z narzędzi w uprawianej przez nas sztuce przetrwania – narzędziem, które jest nam bardzo potrzebne.

column2:
Forever grateful, he shared the technology with us.

<effect>The Interplanetary Astronomy tech has been researched. You can now construct the Omega Telescope wonder.
column3: Forever grateful, he shared the technology with us. Тэхнолёгія Міжплянетная астраномія была дасьледавана. Мы можаце пабудаваць цуд Амега тэлескоп зараз.

column2: Rayan Cox - the astrophysicist whose project we financed a while back – has let us know the technology he was working on has successfully passed the prototype phase.
column3: Rayan Cox - the astrophysicist whose project we financed a while back – has let us know the technology he was working on has successfully passed the prototype phase.
column4: Rayan Cox – astrofizyk, którego projekt sfinansowaliśmy jakiś czas temu – powiadomił nas, że technologia, nad którą pracował, wyszła z fazy prototypowej.

column2:
They are willing to share the patent for their "one of a kind" device that can discover previously undetectable underground deposits of Metals and Rare Metals.

Still, they are asking for a substantial amount of money.
column3:
They are willing to share the patent for their "one of a kind" device that can discover previously undetectable underground deposits of Metals and Rare Metals.

Still, they are asking for a substantial amount of money.

column2: A recent successful startup company from Earth has made us an offer.
column3: A recent successful startup company from Earth has made us an offer.
column4: Pewien udany startup z Ziemi złożył nam propozycję.

column2: This may be pure gold. Literally. Accept!
column3: This may be pure gold. Literally. Accept!
column4: To może być czyste złoto. Dosłownie. Wyrażam zgodę!

column2: How much? We’ll come up with our tech to replicate their "one of a kind" device.
column3: How much? We’ll come up with our tech to replicate their "one of a kind" device.
column4: Ile? Sami sobie poradzimy. Opracujemy technologię, dzięki której zbudujemy to ich „jedyne w swoim rodzaju” urządzenie.

column2: new research will be made available
column3: new research will be made available

column2: Their asking price outweighs the benefits. Politely decline.
column3: Their asking price outweighs the benefits. Politely decline.
column4: Potencjalne korzyści nie są warte takiej ceny. Uprzejmie odmówimy.

column2:
This comes shortly after we received the following cryptic message:

"Seth requires permission to test 'The Bomb' at a safe distance from your Martian colony. These funds should cover inconvenience. 

Does Seth have permission?"
column3:
This comes shortly after we received the following cryptic message:

"Seth requires permission to test 'The Bomb' at a safe distance from your Martian colony. These funds should cover inconvenience. 

Does Seth have permission?"

column2: An unbelievable amount of unaccounted funds has suddenly appeared in our accounts but are currently kept frozen.
column3: An unbelievable amount of unaccounted funds has suddenly appeared in our accounts but are currently kept frozen.
column4: Na jednym z naszych kont pojawiła się niewiarygodna ilość funduszy niewiadomego pochodzenia, jednak konto zostało zamrożone.

column2: What's this? Some kind of a joke? Disregard.
column3: What's this? Some kind of a joke? Disregard.
column4: O co tu chodzi? To jakiś żart? Zignorować.

column2: The money has been withdrawn from our account.
column3: The money has been withdrawn from our account.
column4: Pieniądze zostały wycofane z naszego konta.

column2: It looks like the mysterious offer is now off the table.
column3: It looks like the mysterious offer is now off the table.
column4: Wygląda na to, że tajemnicza propozycja przestała być aktualna.

column2: The Colony can use the additional funding. Answer "YES".
column3: The Colony can use the additional funding. Answer "YES".
column4: Dodatkowe fundusze przydadzą się kolonii. Odpowiedzcie „Tak”.

column2: An enormous blast has been detected, measuring at a mind boggling 500 megatons of TNT.
column3: An enormous blast has been detected, measuring at a mind boggling 500 megatons of TNT.
column4: Wykryto olbrzymią eksplozję, której siła odpowiada oszałamiającym 500 megatonom trotylu.

column2:
The blast was very far away. A small marsquake was detected but the debris from the blast and the winds of the blast wave will hit our base very soon - both at the same time.

At least the money has been unfrozen. Hope we survive long enough to spend it.
column3:
The blast was very far away. A small marsquake was detected but the debris from the blast and the winds of the blast wave will hit our base very soon - both at the same time.

At least the money has been unfrozen. Hope we survive long enough to spend it.

column2: Follow the message and identify the sender. Do it now!
column3: Follow the message and identify the sender. Do it now!
column4: Prześledzić komunikat i zidentyfikować nadawcę. Natychmiast!

column2: We tried to trace the message but whomever was behind it took extreme precautions to prevent this.
column3: We tried to trace the message but whomever was behind it took extreme precautions to prevent this.
column4: Próbowaliśmy wytropić źródło wiadomości, ale ktokolwiek ją wysłał, zastosował nadzwyczajne środki, by temu zapobiec.

column2: The sum has been withdrawn from our account. It looks like the mysterious offer is now off the table.
column3: The sum has been withdrawn from our account. It looks like the mysterious offer is now off the table.
column4: Pieniądze zostały wycofane z naszego konta. Wygląda na to, że tajemnicza propozycja przestała być aktualna.

column2:
The rocket has smashed with its nose in the ground, leaving a miles-long trail behind before the red sand and rocks quenched the immense force of its inertia. The hull is damaged and twisted beyond recognition, rending all attempts to identify the vehicle useless. No information can be found about the crash on any international flight records, either.

We can order the hull to be investigated, but the only way to proceed is to cut through it with blow-torches, which could be dangerous in case there are any dangerous substances or remaining fuel on board.
column3:
The rocket has smashed with its nose in the ground, leaving a miles-long trail behind before the red sand and rocks quenched the immense force of its inertia. The hull is damaged and twisted beyond recognition, rending all attempts to identify the vehicle useless. No information can be found about the crash on any international flight records, either.

We can order the hull to be investigated, but the only way to proceed is to cut through it with blow-torches, which could be dangerous in case there are any dangerous substances or remaining fuel on board.

column2: We have discovered the remains of a crashed rocket at the expedition location.
column3: We have discovered the remains of a crashed rocket at the expedition location.
column4: W miejscu, do którego dotarła ekspedycja, odkryliśmy rozbitą rakietę.
Wejdźcie do środka i zbadajcie sprawę!

column2: The blow-torches ignite a fuel pocket inside the Rocket’s hull. Nothing could have survived the titanic explosion which followed.
column3: The blow-torches ignite a fuel pocket inside the Rocket’s hull. Nothing could have survived the titanic explosion which followed.
column4: Palniki zapaliły paliwo, które zgromadziło się w jednym z zakamarków kadłuba. Nic nie mogło przetrwać tytanicznej eksplozji, jaka nastąpiła.

column2: Cutting carefully through the twisted hull, the expedition managed to gain safe access to the dark cargo hold of the rocket.
column3: Cutting carefully through the twisted hull, the expedition managed to gain safe access to the dark cargo hold of the rocket.
column4: Przeciąwszy ostrożnie poskręcany kadłub rakiety, ekspedycja zdołała otworzyć sobie bezpieczne wejście do pogrążonej w ciemności ładowni.

column2:
It’s a miracle that anything on board survived, but after sifting through the twisted scrap inside the crashed vehicle, the expedition discovered some useful prefabs which were meant for some failed colonization effort.

<effect>You have gained several Building Prefabs. The expedition will return shortly.
column3:
It’s a miracle that anything on board survived, but after sifting through the twisted scrap inside the crashed vehicle, the expedition discovered some useful prefabs which were meant for some failed colonization effort.

<effect>You have gained several Building Prefabs. The expedition will return shortly.

column2: Leave the crash site and return home!
column3: Leave the crash site and return home!
column4: Opuśćcie miejsce katastrofy i wracajcie do domu!

column2: We can access through the weak rock layers around the hull.
column3: We can access through the weak rock layers around the hull.
column4: Może zdołamy tam wejść, ryjąc tunel w miękkiej skale, która otacza kadłub.

column2: After hours of tedious tunneling, the expedition manages to access the hull from below.
column3: After hours of tedious tunneling, the expedition manages to access the hull from below.
column4: Po wielu godzinach żmudnego kopania ekspedycja przedostaje się do wnętrza kadłuba od spodu.

column2:
Immediately afterwards, the hull caves in with ear-piercing screech and a stream of fuel starts pouring through the hole, filling the tunnel. Only a quick evacuation prevented further damage and you’re thankful that you avoided the imminent disaster if you decided to use blow-torches. After a short hassle, the hull is breached in an alternative spot and the cargo hold of the rocket is exposed. Not much has been left intact, but there are still precious items to be salvaged.

<effect>You have gained several Building Prefabs. The expedition will return shortly.
column3:
Immediately afterwards, the hull caves in with ear-piercing screech and a stream of fuel starts pouring through the hole, filling the tunnel. Only a quick evacuation prevented further damage and you’re thankful that you avoided the imminent disaster if you decided to use blow-torches. After a short hassle, the hull is breached in an alternative spot and the cargo hold of the rocket is exposed. Not much has been left intact, but there are still precious items to be salvaged.

<effect>You have gained several Building Prefabs. The expedition will return shortly.

column2:
The dispute which profession is more vital for the colonization effort has polarized the Colonists into two different camps.

You tried to avoid being sucked into the ridiculous debate but were ambushed by representatives of both sides on your way to lunch. 

With your back against the wall they ask: 

"In your opinion, Commander, who is more critical for the colony's success - the Engineer or the Scientist?"
column3:
The dispute which profession is more vital for the colonization effort has polarized the Colonists into two different camps.

You tried to avoid being sucked into the ridiculous debate but were ambushed by representatives of both sides on your way to lunch. 

With your back against the wall they ask: 

"In your opinion, Commander, who is more critical for the colony's success - the Engineer or the Scientist?"

column2: An argument between an Engineer and a Scientist has escalated and is now the talk of the entire Colony.
column3: An argument between an Engineer and a Scientist has escalated and is now the talk of the entire Colony.
column4: Dyskusja między technikiem i naukowcem urosła do rozmiarów ożywionego sporu wśród wszystkich mieszkańców kolonii.

column2: The Scientist's work enables the Engineer to do theirs.
column3: The Scientist's work enables the Engineer to do theirs.

column2: Scientists get Morale boost, Engineers lose Morale for <sols(morale_duration)> Sols
column3: Scientists get Morale boost, Engineers lose Morale for <sols(morale_duration)> Sols
column4: naukowcy otrzymują premię do morale, technicy tracą morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_duration)>).

column2: The Engineer puts to practice the theories of the Scientist.
column3: The Engineer puts to practice the theories of the Scientist.
column4: Technik realizuje teorie naukowca w praktyce.

column2: Engineers get Morale boost, Scientists lose Morale for <sols(morale_duration)> Sols
column3: Engineers get Morale boost, Scientists lose Morale for <sols(morale_duration)> Sols
column4: technicy otrzymują premię do morale, naukowcy tracą morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_duration)>).

column2: What the... this is ridiculous! Both roles are vital!
column3: What the... this is ridiculous! Both roles are vital!
column4: Co do... przecież to śmieszne! Obie profesje są niezbędne!

column2: Engineers and Scientists, like all others on Mars, are parts of a single working system. All our roles are irreplaceable.
column3: Engineers and Scientists, like all others on Mars, are parts of a single working system. All our roles are irreplaceable.
column4: Technicy i naukowcy, podobnie jak wszyscy inni na Marsie, stanowią części tego samego systemu. Wszystkie role są nieodzowne.

column2: Fearing that Earth could be destroyed by a cataclysm, the ten richest customers of Eternal Summer have paid for a rocket to host their cryopods. It has launched towards Mars, where they are relying on your colony to resupply the cosmic ark. Eternal Summer even hints that truly realizing their client's dreams could be very benefitial to us. The Eternal Summer rocket will regularly ask for permission to land. If you resupply it with Fuel, Machine Parts and Electronics, you will immediately receive upon its launch.
column3: Fearing that Earth could be destroyed by a cataclysm, the ten richest customers of Eternal Summer have paid for a rocket to host their cryopods. It has launched towards Mars, where they are relying on your colony to resupply the cosmic ark. Eternal Summer even hints that truly realizing their client's dreams could be very benefitial to us. The Eternal Summer rocket will regularly ask for permission to land. If you resupply it with Fuel, Machine Parts and Electronics, you will immediately receive upon its launch.
column4: Obawiając się zniszczenia Ziemi w jakimś kosmicznym kataklizmie, dziesięcioro najbogatszych klientów Wiecznego Lata opłaciło rakietę, która ma wywieźć w kosmos ich kapsuły krioniczne. Rakieta została wystrzelona w kierunku Marsa, a jej pasażerowie liczą, że nasza kolonia uzupełni zasoby w ich kosmicznej arce. Wieczne Lato sugeruje nawet, że urzeczywistnienie marzeń ich klientów mogłoby być korzystne dla kolonii. Rakieta Wiecznego Lata będzie regularnie prosić o zezwolenie na lądowanie. Jeśli uzupełnisz jej paliwo, części maszyn i artykuły elektroniczne, to w chwili startu natychmiast otrzymasz .

column2: Do you want to live forever? Apparently, the clients of Eternal Summer, a large cryonics company, intend to do so.
column3: Do you want to live forever? Apparently, the clients of Eternal Summer, a large cryonics company, intend to do so.
column4: Kto chciałby żyć wiecznie? Najwyraźniej klienci Wiecznego Lata, korporacji zajmującej się krioniką.

column2: Space is a harsh place, and we wouldn’t leave anyone alone.
column3: Space is a harsh place, and we wouldn’t leave anyone alone.
column4: Kosmos to surowe miejsce, nie pozostawimy nikogo bez pomocy.
To nie brzmi zachęcająco, przykro mi.

column2: Accept and increase the reward to <funding(eternal_summer_reward_oligarch)>
column3: Accept and increase the reward to <funding(eternal_summer_reward_oligarch)>
column4: Wyraź zgodę i zwiększ zapłatę do <funding(eternal_summer_reward_oligarch)>

column2: We won’t ask for compensation. We will do it for free.
column3: We won’t ask for compensation. We will do it for free.
column4: Nie żądamy żadnej rekompensaty. Zrobimy to za darmo.

column2: "It would be an honor to live and work with people like you, Commander!"
column3: "It would be an honor to live and work with people like you, Commander!"
column4: „Żyć i pracować z takimi ludźmi, jak ty, byłoby dla mnie zaszczytem, Dowódco”.

column2: Inspired by your act of genuine nobility, the Eternal Summer's lead scientist, Satoshi Nisei, has requested permission to join your colony.
column3: Inspired by your act of genuine nobility, the Eternal Summer's lead scientist, Satoshi Nisei, has requested permission to join your colony.
column4: Czołowy naukowiec Wiecznego Lata, Satoshi Nisei, zainspirowany twoją szlachetną bezinteresownością, poprosił o przyjęcie do twojej kolonii.

column2: I'm honored, but it would be if you continue working from Earth
column3: I'm honored, but it would be if you continue working from Earth
column4: To zaszczyt także dla mnie, ale wystarczyłoby, gdyby wspomagał pan nasze prace z Ziemi.

column2: An orbital cryopod sanctuary for the filthy rich.
column3: An orbital cryopod sanctuary for the filthy rich.
column4: Orbitalne schronienie dla kriozasobników, przeznaczone dla ludzi obrzydliwie bogatych.

column2: <sleeper_celebrities> Celebrity colonists want to join your colony and receive the benefits of your life-extending medical breakthroughs. Would you accept them?
column3: <sleeper_celebrities> Celebrity colonists want to join your colony and receive the benefits of your life-extending medical breakthroughs. Would you accept them?
column4: Sławni koloniści (<sleeper_celebrities>) chcą przyłączyć się do twojej kolonii i skorzystać z dostępnych na Marsie zdobyczy medycyny w dziedzinie przedłużenia życia. Przyjmiesz ich?

column2: A recent medical breakthrough made on Mars has allowed the Eternal Summer company to revive its customers and now they wish to descend from orbit and revel in the new possibilities for better life.
column3: A recent medical breakthrough made on Mars has allowed the Eternal Summer company to revive its customers and now they wish to descend from orbit and revel in the new possibilities for better life.
column4: Nowy przełom w medycynie umożliwił korporacji Wieczne Lato ożywienie klientów. Teraz chcą oni wylądować na Marsie i rozkoszować się nowymi możliwościami lepszego życia.

column2: Make them wait for a while
column3: Make them wait for a while

column2: Quick to assure you the experiment is perfectly safe, <DisplayName> reluctantly asks for permission to test within the vicinity of a Dome – in case they need to get to shelter really fast.
column3: Quick to assure you the experiment is perfectly safe, <DisplayName> reluctantly asks for permission to test within the vicinity of a Dome – in case they need to get to shelter really fast.
column4: Zapewniając solennie, że eksperyment jest całkowicie bezpieczny, <DisplayName> nieśmiało prosi o zezwolenie na test w pobliżu kopuły – na wypadek, gdyby trzeba było się szybko ukryć.

column2: A Scientist barges into your office and says they have an important climate experiment to make.
column3: A Scientist barges into your office and says they have an important climate experiment to make.
column4: Jeden z naukowców wparowuje do twojego gabinetu i twierdzi, że musi przeprowadzić ważny eksperyment klimatyczny.

column2: Innovation is always welcome! Go ahead – test it near a Dome.
column3: Innovation is always welcome! Go ahead – test it near a Dome.
column4: Innowacje zawsze się przydadzą! Śmiało – przeprowadź eksperyment w pobliżu kopuły.
otrzymasz punkty badań, coś może się wydarzyć.

column2: Sounds intriguing but I’d rather play it safe. Test it somewhere far away.
column3: Sounds intriguing but I’d rather play it safe. Test it somewhere far away.
column4: To brzmi intrygująco, ale wolę zachować ostrożność. Przeprowadź test nieco dalej.
otrzymasz punkty badań, coś może się wydarzyć.

column2: Enough crazy for today. Please, leave my office.
column3: Enough crazy for today. Please, leave my office.
column4: Dość szaleństw na jeden dzień. Proszę opuścić to pomieszczenie.

column2: Our initial scans must be incorrect, but the terrain is treacherous and filled with solid, sharp rocks which prevent the rocket from safely landing at the coordinates.
column3: Our initial scans must be incorrect, but the terrain is treacherous and filled with solid, sharp rocks which prevent the rocket from safely landing at the coordinates.
column4: Nasz pierwotny skan musi być błędny, bo teren jest zdradziecki, pełen twardych, ostrych skał, które uniemożliwiają lądowanie rakiety we wskazanym miejscu.

column2: The expedition Rocket cannot find a suitable place to land near the Anomaly’s location.
column3: The expedition Rocket cannot find a suitable place to land near the Anomaly’s location.
column4: Rakieta ekspedycji nie może znaleźć odpowiedniego miejsca do lądowania w pobliżu anomalii.

column2: Circle and find a good landing spot.
column3: Circle and find a good landing spot.
column4: Okrążcie ten punkt i znajdźcie jakieś miejsce.

column2: After circling on the spot for hours, the Rocket finds a good landing spot.
column3: After circling on the spot for hours, the Rocket finds a good landing spot.
column4: Rakieta krążyła wokół anomalii przez wiele godzin, ale w końcu ekspedycja znalazła miejsce nadające się do lądowania.

column2:
The cracked crust of the planet which prevented us from landing actually reveals rich metal veins. The expedition makes sure the rocket is filled to the brim before taking off – and for a good reason. The rocky terrain of the landing spot crumbles under the immense force of the engines, making the landing spot forever inaccessible, like a treasure vault lost in legends.

<effect>The expedition will return with <polymers(polymer_cargo)> and <metals(metals_cargo)>.
column3:
The cracked crust of the planet which prevented us from landing actually reveals rich metal veins. The expedition makes sure the rocket is filled to the brim before taking off – and for a good reason. The rocky terrain of the landing spot crumbles under the immense force of the engines, making the landing spot forever inaccessible, like a treasure vault lost in legends.

<effect>The expedition will return with <polymers(polymer_cargo)> and <metals(metals_cargo)>.

column2: After circling near the spot for hours, the Rocket finds no suitable place to land.
column3: After circling near the spot for hours, the Rocket finds no suitable place to land.
column4: Rakieta krążyła wokół anomalii przez wiele godzin, ale nie udało się znaleźć miejsca nadającego się do lądowania.

column2:
It’s a pity, for the on-board scanners have detected massive amounts of easily-accessible ore veins right under the jagged rocks. Still, better safe than sorry.

<effect>The expedition will return shortly.
column3:
It’s a pity, for the on-board scanners have detected massive amounts of easily-accessible ore veins right under the jagged rocks. Still, better safe than sorry.

<effect>The expedition will return shortly.

column2: Let's try an unorthodox landing procedure.
column3: Let's try an unorthodox landing procedure.

column2: The region seems to be formed by a massive eruption or another cataclysmic event, as the very crust of the planet is folded and cracked unlike anything we’ve seen so far. Just below the jagged rocks lie rich ore veins. The expedition starts loading the Rocket when a terrible truth is discovered – the rocket has expended too much fuel to make it back with its cargo!
column3: The region seems to be formed by a massive eruption or another cataclysmic event, as the very crust of the planet is folded and cracked unlike anything we’ve seen so far. Just below the jagged rocks lie rich ore veins. The expedition starts loading the Rocket when a terrible truth is discovered – the rocket has expended too much fuel to make it back with its cargo!
column4: Wygląda na to, że okoliczny teren został ukształtowany przez ogromną erupcję lub inny kataklizm, gdyż sama skorupa planety jest pofałdowana i spękana. Nigdy dotąd nie widzieliśmy czegoś takiego. Tuż pod poszarpanymi skałami kryją się bogate złoża minerałów. Ekspedycja zaczyna ładować te skarby do rakiety, gdy odkrywa straszną prawdę – podczas prób lądowania zużyto za dużo paliwa, by udało się wrócić do kolonii wraz z ładunkiem!

column2: After circling around the designated coordinates, the Rocket finds a good spot and lands.
column3: After circling around the designated coordinates, the Rocket finds a good spot and lands.
column4: Po kilku okrążeniach wokół miejsca wskazanego przez współrzędne ekspedycja znajduje dobre miejsce i ląduje.

column2: Throw out the cargo and return!
column3: Throw out the cargo and return!

column2: Try to deliver a portion of the cargo.
column3: Try to deliver a portion of the cargo.

column2: On the way home the rocket lost altitude and crashed down.
column3: On the way home the rocket lost altitude and crashed down.
column4: Lecąc z powrotem do kolonii rakieta utraciła wysokość i rozbiła się.

column2:
Nothing could have survived the titanic explosion!

<effect>The expedition has been lost.
column3:
Nothing could have survived the titanic explosion!

<effect>The expedition has been lost.

column2: The rocket takes off and heads home. Everybody is worried, but the mighty vehicle manages to keep its altitude during the most crucial stage of the flight.
column3: The rocket takes off and heads home. Everybody is worried, but the mighty vehicle manages to keep its altitude during the most crucial stage of the flight.
column4: Rakieta startuje i kieruje się w stronę kolonii. Wszyscy się martwią, ale potężny pojazd daje radę utrzymać wysokość podczas najbardziej krytycznej fazy lotu.

column2:
Turns out one of our Founders-to-be, despite having passed a rigorous vetting program, is now identified as a wanted fugitive.

Interpol hasn't secured the proper permits and currently holds no jurisdiction to force us to turn them in but offers a significant financial incentive if we do so on our own accord.

If we accept, we will effectively have one less Founder.
column3:
Turns out one of our Founders-to-be, despite having passed a rigorous vetting program, is now identified as a wanted fugitive.

Interpol hasn't secured the proper permits and currently holds no jurisdiction to force us to turn them in but offers a significant financial incentive if we do so on our own accord.

If we accept, we will effectively have one less Founder.

column2: Just mere hours after the Founders blasted off for Mars, Interpol contacted us.
column3: Just mere hours after the Founders blasted off for Mars, Interpol contacted us.
column4: Zaledwie kilka godzin po starcie Założycieli na Marsa skontaktował się z nami Interpol.

column2: I believe in second chances! Welcome them to the Colony.
column3: I believe in second chances! Welcome them to the Colony.
column4: Wierzę w drugą szansę! Witaj w kolonii.

column2: We don't want a criminal as one of our Founders. Send them back with the next flight to Earth.
column3: We don't want a criminal as one of our Founders. Send them back with the next flight to Earth.
column4: Nie chcemy przestępców wśród Założycieli. Odesłać poszukiwaną osobę na Ziemię najbliższą rakietą.

column2:
"If you don't want to see the people of this colony left without Water to drink, you must do exactly as I say! First I need a Rocket! Then I need $500 million..."

The video abruptly ends there.

A team of investigators is sent immediately and they found the following: the lifeless body of <DisplayName>, next to a pipe leak. Cause of death - the premature explosion of some poorly made explosive device.
column3:
"If you don't want to see the people of this colony left without Water to drink, you must do exactly as I say! First I need a Rocket! Then I need $500 million..."

The video abruptly ends there.

A team of investigators is sent immediately and they found the following: the lifeless body of <DisplayName>, next to a pipe leak. Cause of death - the premature explosion of some poorly made explosive device.

column2:
There’s a potential breach in our Fusion Reactor. If the magnetic confinement fails, we may be sitting on a fusion bomb. Theoretically, the fail-safes should contain the explosion within the vicinity of the reactor.

The workers have a chance to evacuate. However, several of them have volunteered to try to stop the containment breach from inside.
column3:
There’s a potential breach in our Fusion Reactor. If the magnetic confinement fails, we may be sitting on a fusion bomb. Theoretically, the fail-safes should contain the explosion within the vicinity of the reactor.

The workers have a chance to evacuate. However, several of them have volunteered to try to stop the containment breach from inside.

column2: An Engineer moves to compensate the tiny misalignment in the magnetic confinement caused by the Dust Storm. Suddenly, a siren starts to wail as red lights cover the terminal.
column3: An Engineer moves to compensate the tiny misalignment in the magnetic confinement caused by the Dust Storm. Suddenly, a siren starts to wail as red lights cover the terminal.
column4: Jeden z techników przystępuje do kompensowania niewielkiego przesunięcia pola magnetycznego, spowodowanego przez burzę pyłową. Nagle rozlega się syrena alarmowa, a terminal pokrywają czerwone światełka.

column2: Allow the volunteers to try to stop the meltdown
column3: Allow the volunteers to try to stop the meltdown
column4: Pozwól ochotnikom na próbę opanowania awarii.

column2:
The magnetic containment has failed but our brave Colonists managed to contain the meltdown to the Fusion Reactor. That comes at a great cost, as all the workers gave their lives to save us.

<effect>Fusion Reactor has malfunctioned and needs extra <electronics(breakdown_cost)> for repair. All workers have died.
column3:
The magnetic containment has failed but our brave Colonists managed to contain the meltdown to the Fusion Reactor. That comes at a great cost, as all the workers gave their lives to save us.

<effect>Fusion Reactor has malfunctioned and needs extra <electronics(breakdown_cost)> for repair. All workers have died.

column2: The volunteers have failed to contain the fusion reaction. An explosion is imminent…
column3: The volunteers have failed to contain the fusion reaction. An explosion is imminent…
column4: Ochotnikom nie udało się opanować reakcji fuzji. Za chwilę nastąpi eksplozja…

column2: reaction will be contained but it will cause many Cable Faults and breakdowns
column3: reaction will be contained but it will cause many Cable Faults and breakdowns
column4: reakcja zostanie opanowana, ale spowoduje wiele awarii kabli i innych uszkodzeń.

column2: Evacuate the building !(The Reactor will explode, all workers will be evacuated)
column3: Evacuate the building !(The Reactor will explode, all workers will be evacuated)
column4: Ewakuować budynek! (Reaktor wybuchnie, wszyscy pracownicy zostaną ewakuowani).

column2:
While the initial panic has somewhat subsided, people are still fearful and prefer to remain in their homes. It will take some time until the colony gets back to the normal routine.

<sponsor_name> has suspended the construction of any new Fusion Reactors until investigations are complete.

<effect>”The Incident” tech available. Research it to unlock construction of Fusion Reactors once more.
column3:
While the initial panic has somewhat subsided, people are still fearful and prefer to remain in their homes. It will take some time until the colony gets back to the normal routine.

<sponsor_name> has suspended the construction of any new Fusion Reactors until investigations are complete.

<effect>”The Incident” tech available. Research it to unlock construction of Fusion Reactors once more.

column2: Stop all Fusion Reactors until we know more!
column3: Stop all Fusion Reactors until we know more!
column4: Wyłączcie wszystkie reaktory termojądrowe do czasu, gdy będziemy wiedzieć więcej!
<morale_penalty> do morale kolonistów na pewną liczbę soli (<morale_penalty_sols>).

column2: People need a couple of Sols to process this.
column3: People need a couple of Sols to process this.
column4: Ludzie potrzebują trochę czasu, by to przetrawić.

column2: <morale_penalty_low> Morale for <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols, Fusion Reactors will stop working for <sols(stop_reactors)> Sols only
column3: <morale_penalty_low> Morale for <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols, Fusion Reactors will stop working for <sols(stop_reactors)> Sols only
column4: <morale_penalty_low> do morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_penalty_sols)>), reaktory termojądrowe przerwą pracę tylko na małą liczbę soli (<sols(stop_reactors)>).

column2:
We held a vigil for the fallen heroes. Their bravery will be remembered!

<sponsor_name> has suspended the construction of any new Fusion Reactors until investigations are complete.

<effect>”The Incident” tech available. Research it to unlock construction of Fusion Reactors once more.
column3:
We held a vigil for the fallen heroes. Their bravery will be remembered!

<sponsor_name> has suspended the construction of any new Fusion Reactors until investigations are complete.

<effect>”The Incident” tech available. Research it to unlock construction of Fusion Reactors once more.

column2: Your desk is covered in aftermath reports and damage assessments. The monitor flashes and almost endless stream of messages – some nervous and grief-stricken, others angry and demanding.
column3: Your desk is covered in aftermath reports and damage assessments. The monitor flashes and almost endless stream of messages – some nervous and grief-stricken, others angry and demanding.
column4: Na twoim biurku zalega cała masa raportów powypadkowych i ocen zniszczenia. Monitor wyświetla niekończący się strumień wiadomości – niektóre z nich świadczą o zdenerwowaniu lub są przepełnione smutkiem, ale inne zioną gniewem i stawiają żądania.

column2: Stop all Fusion Reactors until we know more!
column3: Stop all Fusion Reactors until we know more!
column4: Wyłączcie wszystkie reaktory termojądrowe do czasu, gdy będziemy wiedzieć więcej!

column2: People need a couple of Sols to process this.
column3: People need a couple of Sols to process this.
column4: Ludzie potrzebują trochę czasu, by to przetrawić.

column2: <morale_penalty_low> Morale for <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols, Fusion Reactors will stop working for <sols(stop_reactors)> Sols only
column3: <morale_penalty_low> Morale for <sols(morale_penalty_sols)> Sols, Fusion Reactors will stop working for <sols(stop_reactors)> Sols only
column4: <morale_penalty_low> do morale na pewną liczbę soli (<sols(morale_penalty_sols)>), reaktory termojądrowe przerwą pracę tylko na małą liczbę soli (<sols(stop_reactors)>).

column2:
The manual adjustments made by the staff at the Fusion Reactor destabilized the system which would have otherwise self-corrected the effects of the Dust Storm.

Some Colonists are unhappy with this findings and remain skeptical about fusion power.

<effect>Fusion Reactors can be built once more.
column3:
The manual adjustments made by the staff at the Fusion Reactor destabilized the system which would have otherwise self-corrected the effects of the Dust Storm.

Some Colonists are unhappy with this findings and remain skeptical about fusion power.

<effect>Fusion Reactors can be built once more.

column2: All public terminal broadcast as the head of the investigation team reads the report findings out loud. Human error.
column3: All public terminal broadcast as the head of the investigation team reads the report findings out loud. Human error.
column4: Wszystkie publiczne terminale nadają konferencję, na której szef zespołu dochodzeniowego odczytuje raport. Błąd człowieka.

column2: The memory of the incident with the Fusion Reactor is still fresh in the minds of some colonists. Fusion sceptics are against any new Fusion Reactors being built and demand that you take decisive action on the matter.
column3: The memory of the incident with the Fusion Reactor is still fresh in the minds of some colonists. Fusion sceptics are against any new Fusion Reactors being built and demand that you take decisive action on the matter.
column4: Wspomnienie o wypadku z reaktorem termojądrowym jest wciąż świeże w pamięci kolonistów. Sceptycy wobec energii termojądrowej są przeciwni budowie nowych takich reaktorów i żądają podjęcia zdecydowanych działań w tej kwestii.

column2: Angry voices can be heard outside, as the small group of fusion sceptics attempts to push through to your office.
column3: Angry voices can be heard outside, as the small group of fusion sceptics attempts to push through to your office.
column4: Na zewnątrz słychać gniewne głosy – grupka sceptyków energii termojądrowej próbuje wepchnąć się do twojego gabinetu.

column2: We will cancel the construction of the new Fusion Reactor.
column3: We will cancel the construction of the new Fusion Reactor.

column2: *lie* We will cancel the construction of the new Fusion Reactor.
column3: *lie* We will cancel the construction of the new Fusion Reactor.

column2:
The fusion sceptics believed your lie for a couple of Sols. However, once the construction of the Fusion Reactor continued the entire colony saw through the deception.

<effect><morale_penalty_lie> Morale loss for all colonists
column3:
The fusion sceptics believed your lie for a couple of Sols. However, once the construction of the Fusion Reactor continued the entire colony saw through the deception.

<effect><morale_penalty_lie> Morale loss for all colonists

column2:
You know about the great potential of <DisplayName>, and this depressive mood doesn’t seem so strange given the circumstances – a Guru without a path, without an insight to pass on. Maybe you could help?

<effect><DisplayName> will get a new Perk, inspired by your advice.
column3:
You know about the great potential of <DisplayName>, and this depressive mood doesn’t seem so strange given the circumstances – a Guru without a path, without an insight to pass on. Maybe you could help?

<effect><DisplayName> will get a new Perk, inspired by your advice.

column2: "I feel lost, without a purpose." The Colonist in front of you seems to be rather disheartened. "I need your help."
column3: "I feel lost, without a purpose." The Colonist in front of you seems to be rather disheartened. "I need your help."
column4: „Czuję zagubienie, wrażenie bezcelowości”. Osoba stojąca przed tobą wydaje się dość zniechęcona. ”Potrzebuję twojej pomocy”.

column2: Talent is one part gift and five parts hard work.
column3: Talent is one part gift and five parts hard work.
column4: Talent to w jednej szóstej dar i w pięciu szóstych ciężka praca.

column2:
"Thank you, Commander. You made me realize that the answers I was looking for were around me and most importantly – inside of me. I feel complete, as if I’ve found a missing piece of my own self.

Yours sincerely, <DisplayName>"

<effect><DisplayName> has gained the Enthusiast Perk.

column3: The guru leaves, immersed in thoughts. Later, you receive a message which warms your heart.
column4: Guru odchodzi w głębokim zamyśleniu. Jakiś czas później otrzymujesz list, który rozgrzewa twoje serce.

column2:
Transmitting a video stream from inside the building, the angry colonist screams:

"I can’t take it anymore! Machines! Machines! Only bloody, senseless, soulless machines! I will destroy them! ALL OF THEM!"

Then, all of a sudden, the red alert lights flash! <DisplayName> has set the building to self-destruct!
column3:
Transmitting a video stream from inside the building, the angry colonist screams:

"I can’t take it anymore! Machines! Machines! Only bloody, senseless, soulless machines! I will destroy them! ALL OF THEM!"

Then, all of a sudden, the red alert lights flash! <DisplayName> has set the building to self-destruct!

column4: Załamanie psychiczne – I ty zostaniesz luddystą

column2: A colonist has gone mad! Donning a space suit, the unstable individual has occupied one of our Drone Hubs, threatening to destroy it!
column3: A colonist has gone mad! Donning a space suit, the unstable individual has occupied one of our Drone Hubs, threatening to destroy it!
column4: Jakiś kolonista postradał zmysły! Porwał skafander kosmiczny i zabarykadował się w jednym z naszych gniazd dronów, grożąc, że je zniszczy!

column2: We cannot afford to lose the Hub!
column3: We cannot afford to lose the Hub!
column4: Nie możemy sobie pozwolić na utratę tego gniazda!

column2: The repair teams rush into the building and make the best attempts to stop its destruction. Following your instructions, they completely disregard the extraction of the crazy colonist.
column3: The repair teams rush into the building and make the best attempts to stop its destruction. Following your instructions, they completely disregard the extraction of the crazy colonist.
column4: Zespół techników wdziera się do budynku i robi, co może, by zapobiec jego zniszczeniu. Zgodnie z twoimi instrukcjami całkowicie ignoruje obłąkanego kolonistę.

column2: <effect>The building has been saved. <DisplayName> has died.
column3: <effect>The building has been saved. <DisplayName> has died.

column2: Forget about the building, save the colonist!
column3: Forget about the building, save the colonist!

column2: The rescue teams rush into the already collapsing building, searching for the crazed colonist inside. And they succeed, bringing the victim out right before the structure caves in!
column3: The rescue teams rush into the already collapsing building, searching for the crazed colonist inside. And they succeed, bringing the victim out right before the structure caves in!
column4: Ekipa ratunkowa wdarła się do budynku, który miał się już za chwilę rozpaść, i zaczęła szukać obłąkanego kolonisty. Zdołała go odnaleźć i wyprowadzić, zanim cała konstrukcja zawaliła się im na głowy!

column2: <effect>The colonist has been saved. The building has been destroyed.
column3: <effect>The colonist has been saved. The building has been destroyed.
column4: <effect> Kolonista został uratowany. Budynek uległ zniszczeniu.

column2:
Now an entire Dome suffers from depression and project it back towards the Empath, making things even worse. Your head thumps with the pain and despair felt by the empath <DisplayName> while you’re trying to think out a solution to the crisis.

<effect>All colonists lose <sanity_damage> Sanity
column3:
Now an entire Dome suffers from depression and project it back towards the Empath, making things even worse. Your head thumps with the pain and despair felt by the empath <DisplayName> while you’re trying to think out a solution to the crisis.

<effect>All colonists lose <sanity_damage> Sanity

column2: An Empath has suffered a sanity breakdown. Losing control over the darkest emotions, the poor soul projected them towards all people nearby.
column3: An Empath has suffered a sanity breakdown. Losing control over the darkest emotions, the poor soul projected them towards all people nearby.
column4: Pewna osoba obdarzona empatią doznała załamania nerwowego. Utraciwszy kontrolę nad swymi najmroczniejszymi uczuciami, zaczęła je emitować ku wszystkim ludziom przebywającym w pobliżu.

column2: Let’s pray for the poor soul!
column3: Let’s pray for the poor soul!
column4: Módlmy się za tę biedną duszyczkę!

column2: Unsurprisingly, it worked. When the colonists started praying, they generated a stream of positive emotional energy which rejuvenated the broken, desperate mind of the empath.
column3: Unsurprisingly, it worked. When the colonists started praying, they generated a stream of positive emotional energy which rejuvenated the broken, desperate mind of the empath.
column4: Zaskakujące, ale to podziałało. Gdy koloniści zaczęli się modlić, wytworzyli strumień przyjaznych uczuć, który odnowił załamany, zrozpaczony umysł kolonisty obdarzonego empatią.

column2: Attempt to sedate and calm down the empath.
column3: Attempt to sedate and calm down the empath.
column4: Spróbujcie podać środek uspokajający osobie z empatią.

column2: The plan seemed pretty solid. But nothing is ever solid when it concerns an unstable empath.
column3: The plan seemed pretty solid. But nothing is ever solid when it concerns an unstable empath.
column4: Plan wydawał się całkiem rozsądny. Ale gdy ma się do czynienia z empatą o niestabilnym nastroju, nie wszystko idzie zgodnie z planem.

column2:
The poor soul got scared of the people approaching with needles and projected a stream of the purest fear towards them. Luckily, one of the team managed to reach the trembling empath and to inject the sedative before running away, screaming.

<effect>The empath <DisplayName> has been secured. <rescuers_amount> colonists lose <insanity_damage> Sanity.
column3:
The poor soul got scared of the people approaching with needles and projected a stream of the purest fear towards them. Luckily, one of the team managed to reach the trembling empath and to inject the sedative before running away, screaming.

<effect>The empath <DisplayName> has been secured. <rescuers_amount> colonists lose <insanity_damage> Sanity.

column2: Luckily, the plan worked. Now the Empath sleeps serenely in a comfy bed.
column3: Luckily, the plan worked. Now the Empath sleeps serenely in a comfy bed.
column4: Na szczęście plan poskutkował. Kolonista z empatią śpi spokojnie w wygodnym łóżku.

column2:
