column2:
"I can't take it anymore!" - yells assistant <DisplayName>. "It is following me everywhere, even in the bathroom."

Looking at the report, you see the colonist has ordered a Drone to crash against the dome wall where one of the alien shades was harmlessly shimmering and flickering -  or whatever aliens do when not buzzing shapes of ideas in people's heads. The dome is cracked and the drone is smashed beyond repairs. Of course, no aliens were harmed in the process.

column2:
The creatures of shimmering air who have revealed to us the secrets of the universe have another message for us. Now we know the correct way to read it and our scientists are excited to make a second contact. The message reads:

WE ADD. YOU ADD. EQUATION. THANKS FOR ALL THE <><.

We have learned from them and they have learned from us. Everyone is happy. We can only hope that future encounters with sentient species would be so much fruitful.
column3:

We have learned from them and they have learned from us. Everyone is happy. We can only hope that future encounters with sentient species would be so much fruitful.

column3: What is the meaning of it all?

column2:
The lead researcher investigating the alien Pyramid has come to your office with exciting news. When an ultraviolet laser at a  particular wavelength is directed at the object, the reaction interval is zero: in this case, the light comes out immediately, and it projects a 3D picture of geometrical proportions. The scientist managed to decrypt a simple message, and its rough meaning is in front of you in the form of text compiled by her.

CHANGE IS PROPER. WE ADD TO YOUR SUM. YOU MULTIPLY.

As it seems, for some reason they enjoy our terraforming effort and are willing to support it. Try not to think why they are happy with us "multiplying". 

We have no means to communicate with these creatures. We can give them an answer only with our actions, and hope all is settled.

column2: We should organize our cooperation in an orderly fashion.
column3: We should organize our cooperation in an orderly fashion.
column4: Powinniśmy zorganizować naszą współpracę w sposób uporządkowany.

column2:
"ALIENS INVADING MARS! Terrible creatures crawling in the domes! Unspeakable things happen on the red planet! Authorities refuse to comment. How long will they hide THE HORRIBLE TRUTH?!?"

You read the news from the page of a popular e-Tabloid on Earth, and your head feels heavy. The tourist <DisplayName> appears to be a sensation-hungry correspondent of the yellow press. Soon your screen flickers with messages from Earth media, random people and, most importantly, your sponsor.

Everything is okay with the extraterrestrials and we hardly notice their presence lately, but how do we explain this to the Earthlings and avert the panic?
column3:

column2: Talk to them and demand they publish another article telling the truth.
column3: Talk to them and demand they publish another article telling the truth.

column2:
Under pressure, <DisplayName> agrees to write another article, explaining that the Martian "shimmering" aliens are absolutely harmless and they don't even show around, let alone pose a threat to someone.

No one seems to have read the second article. Your Sponsor though has a hard time explaining and addressing absurd claims.

<effect>Your Sponsor research has been lost for <sols(pause_research)> Sols. You have gained <tourists> Tourist Applicants.

No one with their mind would believe this is something more than crazy conspiracy theories, so when the article of <DisplayName> comes out, all you need to do is just mock it.

<effect>There are <tourists_wacko> wacko Tourist Applicants though.

column2:
You manage to gather a group of colonists in exploration suits, armed with air compressors, and urge them to fight an imaginary foe on the streets of the dome. You film them with a flickering camera and "accidentally" leak the video.

Everyone on Earth cheers for the brave Martian colonists. Your Sponsor is disgusted.

<effect>Your Sponsor research has been lost for <sols(pause_research)> Sols. You have gained <funding(money_gain)> as foreign aid.

column2:
It was just some yellow article at first, but since you didn't deny, it sparked the curiosity of more serious investigating journalists. It became the story of the year back on Earth. 
Unneeded attention is bad for business, as it seems.

<effect>Rare Metals export price has been decreased to 50% for <sols(pause_research)> Sols.
There are <tourists> curious Tourist Applicants though.

column2:
The creatures appearing like shimmering air who helped in our terraforming effort have another message for us. Now we know the correct way to read it and our scientists are excited to make a second contact. The message reads:

CHANGE IS 1. TOTAL IS PROPER. INCREASE TO INFINITY.

It feels like a pat on the shoulder. We may never learn why they wanted us to survive as a species.
column3:
The creatures appearing like shimmering air who helped in our terraforming effort have another message for us. Now we know the correct way to read it and our scientists are excited to make a second contact. The message reads:

CHANGE IS 1. TOTAL IS PROPER. INCREASE TO INFINITY.

It feels like a pat on the shoulder. We may never learn why they wanted us to survive as a species.

column2: We have received another crystal pyramid.

column3: A pat on the shoulder? We deserve it!

column2: Now we owe the same favor to whoever needs it.
column3: Now we owe the same favor to whoever needs it.
column4: Teraz jesteśmy winni podobną przysługę każdemu, kto będzie jej potrzebować.

column2:
The lead researcher investigating the alien Pyramid has come to your office with exciting news. When an ultraviolet laser at a  particular wavelength is directed at the object, the reaction interval is zero: in this case, the light comes out immediately, and it projects a 3D picture of geometrical proportions. The scientist managed to decrypt a simple message, and its rough meaning is in front of you in the form of text compiled by her.

THIS PLANET IS OUR HOME. WE MADE IT BE AS IT IS. SET CHANGE TO 0.

As it seems, they claim they have "xenoformed" Mars to the state in which we found it, and they don't want you to terraform it, for it will lose its favorable conditions for them. 

We have no means to communicate with these creatures. We can give them an answer only with our actions, and hope all is settled.

THIS PLANET IS OUR HOME. WE MADE IT BE AS IT IS. SET CHANGE TO 0.

As it seems, they claim they have "xenoformed" Mars to the state in which we found it, and they don't want you to terraform it, for it will lose its favorable conditions for them. 

We have no means to communicate with these creatures. We can give them an answer only with our actions, and hope all is settled.

column2: You can't take Mars from me! Send Security Officers to preserve order.
column3: You can't take Mars from me! Send Security Officers to preserve order.
column4: Nie odbierzecie nam Marsa! Wyślij funkcjonariuszy bezpieczeństwa, aby pilnowali porządku.

column2: Slow down terraforing and try to leave some places of Mars untouched.
column3: Slow down terraforing and try to leave some places of Mars untouched.
column4: Spowolnić terraforming, postarajmy się pozostawić niektóre części Marsa nietknięte.

column2: I know how to postpone the changes without losing too much work.
column3: I know how to postpone the changes without losing too much work.
column4: Wiem, jak opóźnić zmiany bez utraty większości prac.

column2:
A little girl sneaks into your office and rides the visitors' chair. Miss <DisplayName> looks very excited.

"I have to show you something", she says, and gives you a stern look. "But it's a secret! You mustn't tell anyone."

"Why me?"

"'Cause you're the Commander, of course" - she looks disappointed how silly adults are. "Will you come?"
column3:
A little girl sneaks into your office and rides the visitors' chair. Miss <DisplayName> looks very excited.

"I have to show you something", she says, and gives you a stern look. "But it's a secret! You mustn't tell anyone."

"Why me?"

"'Cause you're the Commander, of course" - she looks disappointed how silly adults are. "Will you come?"

column2: Sorry, lass, no time for games. I have a colony to look after.
column3: Sorry, lass, no time for games. I have a colony to look after.
column4: Przykro mi, panienko, nie mam czasu na zabawy. Muszę zarządzać kolonią.

column2:
It seems you were right to stay on your post, since shortly after the girl leaves, an emergency signal flickers on the terraforming sensors screen. In the next few hours you are busy with the containment of a forest fire, a dome garden burnt to ashes and a whole pile of reports about "shimmering shades" here and there. You may have thought those strange creatures gave up, but it seems there are still some of them.
At least your people are relieved you're always vigilant.

<effect>Mars has lost <resource(terr_veg_loss,'VegetationTP')>. A Garden is destroyed.
All worker Colonists gain <morale_gain> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols.
column3:
It seems you were right to stay on your post, since shortly after the girl leaves, an emergency signal flickers on the terraforming sensors screen. In the next few hours you are busy with the containment of a forest fire, a dome garden burnt to ashes and a whole pile of reports about "shimmering shades" here and there. You may have thought those strange creatures gave up, but it seems there are still some of them.
At least your people are relieved you're always vigilant.

<effect>Mars has lost <resource(terr_veg_loss,'VegetationTP')>. A Garden is destroyed.
All worker Colonists gain <morale_gain> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols.

column2:
The little girl leads you to a Dome garden. "See", she says and points, "this is the sad Boogeyman".

There is really a patch of wavering, shimmering space in the bushes.

"What does he want?"

The girl looks at you as if you are extremely stupid to ask. "He hates it here. Our planet... their planet, it was their home. And it hurts them. He says, we stop planting veggies for a while. They need some more time to leave."
column3:
The little girl leads you to a Dome garden. "See", she says and points, "this is the sad Boogeyman".

There is really a patch of wavering, shimmering space in the bushes.

"What does he want?"

The girl looks at you as if you are extremely stupid to ask. "He hates it here. Our planet... their planet, it was their home. And it hurts them. He says, we stop planting veggies for a while. They need some more time to leave."

column2: Some vegetation may wither, but I suppose we can do that.
column3: Some vegetation may wither, but I suppose we can do that.
column4: Część roślinności chyba zwiędnie, ale myślę, że możemy to zrobić.

column2:
With heavy heart, you order a central irrigation shutdown. In the next few hours you receive worried reports about withering plants, but a promise is a promise.

Just when you're beginning to regret it a little, your assistants find another Pyramid. The message it contains speaks nothing to you - but physicists are in awe.

<effect>Mars has lost <resource(terr_veg_loss_big,'VegetationTP')>.
You have gained <research(research)>.
column3:

column2: Sorry, girl, we have worked hard to create what we have here.
column3: Sorry, girl, we have worked hard to create what we have here.
column4: Przykro mi, mała, ale ciężko pracowaliśmy, żeby stworzyć tu to, co mamy.

column2:
When you return to your office, an emergency signal welcomes you on the terraforming sensors screen. In the next few hours you are busy with the containment of a forest fire and a whole pile of reports about "shimmering shades" here and there. It looks like the alien creatures are sore losers.

Good thing the girl has warned you, so you can act swiftly and efficiently. However, people tend to blame you for not being on your post when it all started - as if you could do something more.

<effect>Mars has lost <resource(terr_veg_loss_small,'VegetationTP')>.
All worker Colonists have lost <morale_penalty> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols.
column3:
When you return to your office, an emergency signal welcomes you on the terraforming sensors screen. In the next few hours you are busy with the containment of a forest fire and a whole pile of reports about "shimmering shades" here and there. It looks like the alien creatures are sore losers.

Good thing the girl has warned you, so you can act swiftly and efficiently. However, people tend to blame you for not being on your post when it all started - as if you could do something more.

<effect>Mars has lost <resource(terr_veg_loss_small,'VegetationTP')>.

column2: There is no sign from the mysterious alien species which once resisted our terraforming effort. Have they given up and went somewhere else? Have they gone extinct? We may never find out.
column3: There is no sign from the mysterious alien species which once resisted our terraforming effort. Have they given up and went somewhere else? Have they gone extinct? We may never find out.
column4: Nie ma już śladów obecności tajemniczych obcych istot, które kiedyś przeciwstawiały się naszym pracom terraformującym. Zrezygnowały i odeszły w inne miejsce? A może wyginęły? Chyba nigdy się tego nie dowiemy.

column2: Since quite some time there are no reports of shimmering air anymore.
column3: Since quite some time there are no reports of shimmering air anymore.
column4: Od dość dawna nie pojawiają się nowe doniesienia o lśnieniu w powietrzu.

column2: I am sorry we couldn't find a better solution, but I'm also relieved.
column3: I am sorry we couldn't find a better solution, but I'm also relieved.
column4: Szkoda, że nie znaleźliśmy lepszego rozwiązania, ale czuję też ulgę.

column2:
The terraforming expert leads you to a large aquarium in the lab. "Commander, look!". You see something resembling a large brown pot, almost half your height, with a large opening on the top side. You flinch with a small deja vu feeling running through you. You almost expect that something will crawl up from there and jump through the glass. Of course, this is just a Sea Sponge, a harmless creature which can live well in the salty waters of Mars.

"We have given it a name", grins your advisor. We call it "Nostromo".

Damn scientists and their sense of humor. Under what name would you announce the spreading of this organism on Mars?

<effect>Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg,'VegetationTP')>.
column3:

column2: The conditions on Mars have improved enough to introduce simple organisms like the Sea Sponges.
column3: The conditions on Mars have improved enough to introduce simple organisms like the Sea Sponges.
column4: Warunki na Marsie są na tyle dobre, że można introdukować proste organizmy żywe, takie jak gąbki.

column2:
It will be within shooting range of our MDS Lasers in 1 Sol. We can destroy them to trigger a shower of ice crystals and meteorites to the planetary surface.

<effect>You have 1 Sol to place additional MDS Lasers in order to intercept some of the meteorites.

column3: We have located a large ice meteorite cluster which will fly nearby.
column4: Wykryliśmy wielki rój lodowych meteorów, który będzie przelatywać w pobliżu Marsa.

column2: The meteorites which we manage to shoot will explode in debris fallout and enrich the Martian atmosphere with evaporated water and gases. On the other hand, they will probably cause some damage.
column3: The meteorites which we manage to shoot will explode in debris fallout and enrich the Martian atmosphere with evaporated water and gases. On the other hand, they will probably cause some damage.

column3: Now is the perfect time for fireworks!

column2: Meteor bombardment doesn't sound like a safe thing to do for our colony.
column3: Meteor bombardment doesn't sound like a safe thing to do for our colony.
column4: Bombardowanie meteorytami nie wygląda mi na coś, co byłoby bezpieczne dla kolonii.

column2:
"Commander, take a look!". She produces a complicated model of a fuel refinery. "Don't mind the smoke. We can now emit as much filth as we want to!"

It takes some time to grasp her idea: we can improve our fuel refineries in such an eco-unfriendly way, they would use up more Water and dump a tremendous amount of exhaust gases in the atmosphere. This, in turn, would help us terraform the Martian atmosphere over time. We can even expect some efficiency improvement - provided, of course, one is inclined to call "efficiency" when +50% amount of Water is used for a mere 10% Fuel production increase.

<effect>Fuel Refineries can be "improved" to waste 50%-100% more Water, produce 10%-25% more Fuel and slightly increase planetary Atmosphere over time.

column2:
This mineral contains calcium fluoride with traces of Uranium-238. It is beautifully violet, slightly radioactive and it makes your Commander's office smell like hell. 

What is important is that when crushed, this mineral releases gases in the atmosphere which help the greenhouse effect on Mars. All we need to do is to set explosives and blow it up!

column2: Why do half the job? Let's nuke it and escalate the effect.
column3: Why do half the job? Let's nuke it and escalate the effect.
column4: Po co działać połowicznie? Rzućmy w to atomówką i spotęgujmy efekt.

column2: So now we detonate toxic radioactive rocks in order to make the planet habitable? Just no.
column3: So now we detonate toxic radioactive rocks in order to make the planet habitable? Just no.
column4: Więc teraz mamy zdetonować toksyczne radioaktywne skały, aby planeta lepiej nadawała się do zamieszkania? W żadnym razie.

column2:
The expedition returned, with drones bruised and covered with dust, but fully functional. You have the honor of pressing the button. A distant thunder indicates the minerals have been successfully detonated.

column2:
Your biochemistry advisor comes with a petri dish in hand and a triumphant smile on her face. "Commander, see who survived the last ten years in the freezer!"

The cute microscopic water bears are able to withstand unbelievable amounts of pressure, cold, heat and radiation, provided they have just a little moisture. Their natural resilience will give us a solid species to lean on while building a biosphere here on Mars.

The cute microscopic water bears are able to withstand unbelievable amounts of pressure, cold, heat and radiation, provided they have just a little moisture. Their natural resilience will give us a solid species to lean on while building a biosphere here on Mars.

column2: Now that we have liquid water on Mars, we can introduce those fascinating little creatures to it.
column3: Now that we have liquid water on Mars, we can introduce those fascinating little creatures to it.
column4: Skoro na Marsie jest już ciekła woda, możemy wprowadzić do środowiska te fascynujące stworzonka.

column3: We can prepare canisters with tardigrades and shoot them from space.

column4: Nie możemy zrobić tak okrutnych rzeczy tym uroczym wodnym misiom.

<effect>Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg,'VegetationTP')>.

column2:
"Commander, remember the canisters with Tardigrades we have spread in Mars' waters some time ago? Well, turns out their population has reached as far as the poles, and most of them actually survived the blast! Even more to that, their new generation has developed higher tolerance to unfavorable conditions. We can have a party, Commander!"

<effect>Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg,'VegetationTP')>.

column2: Your biochemistry advisor enters your office, her cheeks red and her face glowing with happy triumph.
column3: Your biochemistry advisor enters your office, her cheeks red and her face glowing with happy triumph.
column4: Twoja konsultantka do spraw biochemii wpada do twojego gabinetu z zarumienionymi policzkami i triumfalnym uśmiechem.

column2:
Your security advisor comes to your office with a rare expression of confusion on her face. She explains there is a colonist who has been caught counterfeiting documents about himself. The strange thing is, on the fake identity chip he produced, he is 30 years old; and the previous one shows 53. She was diligent enough to check further and she discovered a chain of similar infringements... as it seems, all done by the same person. Unlikely as it sounds, this man had lived for decades without aging a day.

We know him by the name of John Altmann.
column3:
Your security advisor comes to your office with a rare expression of confusion on her face. She explains there is a colonist who has been caught counterfeiting documents about himself. The strange thing is, on the fake identity chip he produced, he is 30 years old; and the previous one shows 53. She was diligent enough to check further and she discovered a chain of similar infringements... as it seems, all done by the same person. Unlikely as it sounds, this man had lived for decades without aging a day.

We know him by the name of John Altmann.

column2: Arrange a private meeting with this person.
column3: Arrange a private meeting with this person.
column4: Zorganizujmy prywatne spotkanie z tą osobą.

column2: Pretend we haven't noticed and secretly watch him.
column3: Pretend we haven't noticed and secretly watch him.
column4: Udawajmy, że nic nie zauważyliśmy, i obserwujmy go potajemnie.

column2: Let him be, whoever he is.
column3: Let him be, whoever he is.

column2:
Mr. Altmann tells you the story of a colonist who has discovered here a unique type of moss: an extract of it can be health improving, prolong one's life and even repair damaged DNA chains. 

The colonist who made this discovery was Mr. Altmann himself. He lived for very long time - over the years he has faked his own death and changed his identity several times. Eventually he became tired of hiding something in a world that is already too small, and became negligent about keeping his secret safe.

This moss he discovered reproduces very slowly and there just isn't enough for everybody. And the irony of the situation is, the moment when the shifting climate of Mars settles to more Earth-like conditions, it will be extinct.
column3:
Mr. Altmann tells you the story of a colonist who has discovered here a unique type of moss: an extract of it can be health improving, prolong one's life and even repair damaged DNA chains. 

The colonist who made this discovery was Mr. Altmann himself. He lived for very long time - over the years he has faked his own death and changed his identity several times. Eventually he became tired of hiding something in a world that is already too small, and became negligent about keeping his secret safe.

This moss he discovered reproduces very slowly and there just isn't enough for everybody. And the irony of the situation is, the moment when the shifting climate of Mars settles to more Earth-like conditions, it will be extinct.

column4: Ludzie zasługują na to, by wiedzieć.

column2: This treasure must be shared with the people! I know the right people.
column3: This treasure must be shared with the people! I know the right people.
column4: Musimy podzielić się tą tajemnicą z ludźmi! I nawet znam odpowiednich ludzi.
Czy możecie wyobrazić sobie te możliwości?!

column2: Your secret is safe with me.
column3: Your secret is safe with me.

column2:
Your security advisor reports that Mr. Altmann somehow found out he was being watched. He managed to steal a space suit and disappear. Security officers found a package and a note in his apartment:

"Commander, I have my reasons to believe that you will grasp what I have to say. I am an ambassador from another civilization which conquered space long ago. My mission here is done and I assure you that I have the best possible impression of your people. I shall advocate for you in the Galactic Council. Now I know I have to disappear for the good of everyone. Don't look for me, for you will not find me. 
As a parting gift, I'm leaving this growth substance. Spread it throughout Mars and let it flourish."

Your botanists confirm that the substance is some sort of a moss which can slowly replicate.

<effect>John Altmann disappeared. Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg,'VegetationTP')>.

column2:
Your security advisor reports that Mr. John Altmann, the colonist she has found out to have extraordinary long life, has recently disappeared. He probably boarded a rocket.

Your terraforming advisor also has some news. There is a substantial rise of the Vegetation parameter, and botanists are baffled why. You may have your reasons to believe this is a good-bye gift from Mr. Altmann, but we will never learn the truth.

<effect>John Altmann disappeared. Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg,'VegetationTP')>.

Your terraforming advisor also has some news. There is a substantial rise of the Vegetation parameter, and botanists are baffled why. You may have your reasons to believe this is a good-bye gift from Mr. Altmann, but we will never learn the truth.

<effect>John Altmann disappeared. Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg,'VegetationTP')>.

column2: Was he an alien? The truth is out there, but we may never know.
column3: Was he an alien? The truth is out there, but we may never know.
column4: Czy on naprawdę był kosmitą? Chyba nigdy się tego nie dowiemy.

column2: Mother Nature works in mysterious ways.
column3: Mother Nature works in mysterious ways.

column2: Send his description to Interpol, let them deal with him.
column3: Send his description to Interpol, let them deal with him.
column4: Wyślijcie jego rysopis do Interpolu, niech oni się nim zajmą.

column2:
This morning, Mr. Altmann was found dead in his apartment. He was barbarously decapitated with a long kitchen knife. A masked colonist was seen to leave his place, screaming "There can be only one!".

On the bright side, the research of the mysterious moss which provided the extraordinarily long life of the late Mr. Altmann has revealed interesting possibilities. This kind of vegetation is unstable, but it can greatly improve the biosphere for other species. Or, alternatively, we can experiment with improvements of the human genome.

<effect>John Altmann is dead.
column3:
This morning, Mr. Altmann was found dead in his apartment. He was barbarously decapitated with a long kitchen knife. A masked colonist was seen to leave his place, screaming "There can be only one!".

On the bright side, the research of the mysterious moss which provided the extraordinarily long life of the late Mr. Altmann has revealed interesting possibilities. This kind of vegetation is unstable, but it can greatly improve the biosphere for other species. Or, alternatively, we can experiment with improvements of the human genome.

<effect>John Altmann is dead.

column2: The future of humankind matters more than our lives.
column3: The future of humankind matters more than our lives.
column4: Przyszłość ludzkości jest ważniejsza niż nasze życie.

column2: The universe has any meaning only through Human perspective.
column3: The universe has any meaning only through Human perspective.
column4: Wszechświat ma znaczenie tylko z perspektywy człowieka.

column2: We're here to help Old Earth solve its problems.
column3: We're here to help Old Earth solve its problems.
column4: Jesteśmy tutaj, by pomóc Staruszce Ziemi w rozwiązaniu jej problemów.

column2: send it to Earth and gain <funding(funding_gain)>
column3: send it to Earth and gain <funding(funding_gain)>
column4: wyślij mech na Ziemię, a otrzymasz <funding(funding_gain)>

column2: We can artificially replicate this moss and create a more adaptive GMO sort.
column3: We can artificially replicate this moss and create a more adaptive GMO sort.
column4: Możemy rozmnożyć sztucznie ten mech i stworzyć odmianę GMO o lepszych zdolnościach przystosowawczych.

column2: The moss of Mr. Altmann is not enough to make us all immortal, but we can learn so much from it and improve our very nature. We could live a happy life, unrestrained by the burden of old age, or even be reborn by transferring our consciousness to a young body!
column3: The moss of Mr. Altmann is not enough to make us all immortal, but we can learn so much from it and improve our very nature. We could live a happy life, unrestrained by the burden of old age, or even be reborn by transferring our consciousness to a young body!
column4: Mech pana Altmanna nie wystarczy, by uczynić nas nieśmiertelnymi, ale możemy się z niego wiele dowiedzieć i ulepszyć naszą egzystencję. Moglibyśmy wieść szczęśliwsze życie, wolne od brzemienia strachu przed starością, a nawet odradzać się, przenosząc naszą świadomość do młodszego ciała!

column2: It always bothered me that just when you learn the ropes, you lose the strength to pull them.
column3: It always bothered me that just when you learn the ropes, you lose the strength to pull them.
column4: Zawsze mnie dręczyło, że akurat gdy człowiek dojdzie do tego, jak żyć, traci siły do życia.

column2: If I could be young again, I'd never make the same mistakes. I shall explore new options!
column3: If I could be young again, I'd never make the same mistakes. I shall explore new options!
column4: Gdybyśmy mogli odzyskać młodość, nie popełnilibyśmy drugi raz tych samych błędów. Zbadamy nowe możliwości!

column2: On second thought, all is vanity.
column3: On second thought, all is vanity.
column4: Z drugiej strony, marność nad marnościami...

column2:
He wants to intentionally make shuttles a lot less effective by doubling the fuel consumption. As a result, they would produce a hell of exhaust gases which ultimately contribute to a Greenhouse effect for warming up Mars. Also, shuttles may move a bit faster. We can only hope they won't accidentally explode.

<effect>Shuttles can be "improved" to burn 50%-100% more Fuel, move 10%-25% faster and slightly increase planetary Temperature over time.
column3:
He wants to intentionally make shuttles a lot less effective by doubling the fuel consumption. As a result, they would produce a hell of exhaust gases which ultimately contribute to a Greenhouse effect for warming up Mars. Also, shuttles may move a bit faster. We can only hope they won't accidentally explode.

<effect>Shuttles can be "improved" to burn 50%-100% more Fuel, move 10%-25% faster and slightly increase planetary Temperature over time.

column2: An engineer comes to your office with a bunch of schematics in hand and a ridiculous idea in mind.
column3: An engineer comes to your office with a bunch of schematics in hand and a ridiculous idea in mind.
column4: W twoim gabinecie pojawia się jakiś technik z garścią planów w dłoni i pewnym idiotycznym pomysłem.

column2: Oh, I like my shuttles dirty.
column3: Oh, I like my shuttles dirty.
column4: O tak, niech kopcą, ile wlezie.

column2: unlock a research for Shuttle Afterburners
column3: unlock a research for Shuttle Afterburners
column4: odblokowuje badania naukowe nad technologią „Dopalacze wahadłowców”

column2: Everyone can screw up something, but it takes a real engineer to do it good and proper!
column3: Everyone can screw up something, but it takes a real engineer to do it good and proper!
column4: Każdy może coś popsuć, ale żeby zrobić to porządnie, potrzeba prawdziwego technika!

column2: unlock a research for Advanced Shuttle Afterburners
column3: unlock a research for Advanced Shuttle Afterburners
column4: odblokowuje badania naukowe nad technologią „Zaawansowane dopalacze wahadłowców”

column2: What's next? Nuke our Domes to heat up the planet?
column3: What's next? Nuke our Domes to heat up the planet?
column4: Co będzie następne? Obrzucenie kopuł atomówkami, żeby podgrzać planetę?

column2: Because of the new design, when a shuttle is watched from the ground, there can be seen thin trails of vaporized water. Some people are convinced these "chemtrails" are part of your wicked plan to conquer their minds using psychotropic substances spread by the shuttle afterburners.
column3: Because of the new design, when a shuttle is watched from the ground, there can be seen thin trails of vaporized water. Some people are convinced these "chemtrails" are part of your wicked plan to conquer their minds using psychotropic substances spread by the shuttle afterburners.
column4: Z powodu zmian konstrukcyjnych obserwowany z powierzchni wahadłowiec pozostawia za sobą cienką strugę pary wodnej. Niektórzy ludzie są przekonani, że te „chemtrails„ stanowią element twojego pokrętnego planu opanowania ludzkich umysłów z użyciem substancji psychotropowych rozpylanych przez dopalacze wahadłowców.

column2: Publish all the plans and schematics of shuttles and their afterburners.
column3: Publish all the plans and schematics of shuttles and their afterburners.
column4: Opublikuj wszystkie plany wahadłowców i ich dopalaczy.

column2:
"That's what they want us to believe!"

Surprisingly, it seems there are people who only accept proof that supports their viewpoint - and there are others who think that since you are being defensive, you definitely have something to hide.

It's not easy to be the Commander.

<effect>All Idiot colonists and <morale_percent>% non-Engineer colonists lose <morale_loss> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols.
column3:
"That's what they want us to believe!"

Surprisingly, it seems there are people who only accept proof that supports their viewpoint - and there are others who think that since you are being defensive, you definitely have something to hide.

It's not easy to be the Commander.

column2: Publicly dismantle a shuttle and put it on display to show there is nothing wrong.
column3: Publicly dismantle a shuttle and put it on display to show there is nothing wrong.
column4: Zorganizuj publiczną rozbiórkę wahadłowca i udostępnienie go jako eksponatu, który każdy może obejrzeć. Niech widzą, że wszystko jest w porządku.

column2:
Everything goes smoothly and by the numbers - there is a crowd of curious colonists; the chief engineer dismounts the shuttle and cracks jokes; people applaud. 

However, an hour later you get a report of masked colonists breaking into a Shuttle Hub and destroying shuttles - probably to ensure they are not being lied to about the "chemtrails".
Sometimes it's hard when people live so close together.

<effect><shuttles_lost> Shuttles have been lost.

column2: Devise a story about shuttles spraying a special fluid to protect the public from aliens.
column3: Devise a story about shuttles spraying a special fluid to protect the public from aliens.
column4: Spreparuj historyjkę o tym, że wahadłowce rozpylają specjalny płyn zapewniający ludziom ochronę przed kosmitami.

column2:
There are colonists who are excited about that. There are others who are unable to see the bigger picture and feel frustrated about it. You can't make everyone happy, it seems.

<effect>All Idiot colonists gain the Nerd trait. 
<morale_percent>% Engineer colonists lose <morale_loss> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols.

column2: This is ridiculous. Do nothing and refuse to comment.
column3: This is ridiculous. Do nothing and refuse to comment.
column4: To jakaś farsa. Nie rób nic i odmów komentarza.

column2:
It seems there are some who don't trust you to decide what is best for the colony.

An aggressive crowd gathers near a Shuttle Hub, but your security officers stand strong, solid and imperturbable in front of it. People shout a bit, then disperse.

<effect>All Idiot colonists lose <morale_loss> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols.
column3:

column2:
It seems there are some who don't trust you to decide what is best for the colony.

An aggressive crowd manages to get into one of the shuttle hubs and cause irreversible damage to the electronics. Since you don't have enough security, there is nothing to do to stop them from destroying the sensitive equipment.

<effect>All Idiot colonists lose <morale_loss> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols. 
A Shuttle Hub has been destroyed.

<effect>All Idiot colonists lose <morale_loss> Morale for <sols(morale_sols)> Sols. 
A Shuttle Hub has been destroyed.

column2:
The famous scientist Dr. Washington Irving who has spent his entire life working on various exotic projects, has recently died. His scientific legacy happened to fall in the hands of the ruthless governor of the insignificant island of Equatorico. He contacted us with an offer to sell the most valuable work of the deceased genius – a vial of Water-Nine, an unstable water formula consisting of different isotopes of Hydrogen and Oxygen. One of the wondrous properties of this water is that it can enter a chemical reaction with frozen water and turn it into Water-Nine, promising a quick Temperature and Water increase even in the harsh conditions of Mars, with overall gain estimated above 10%!

The only problem is, this greedy governor requested a ridiculous sum for a single precious vial of Water-Nine.
column3:

One of the wondrous properties of this water is that it can enter a chemical reaction with frozen water and turn it into Water-Nine, promising a quick Temperature and Water increase even in the harsh conditions of Mars, with overall gain estimated above 10%!

The only problem is, this greedy governor requested a ridiculous sum for a single precious vial of Water-Nine.

column2: A scientist from Earth discovered a new form of water.
column3: A scientist from Earth discovered a new form of water.
column4: Pewien ziemski naukowiec odkrył nową odmianę wody.

column2: It is a small cost for such a great improvement!
column3: It is a small cost for such a great improvement!
column4: To mała cena za tak wielki postęp!

column2:
As long as the first drop of water touches the ice, it starts smoking and hissing. A bubbling crater forms on the surface of the ice deposit, quickly extending its diameter in a violent reaction. The little traces of frozen water in the air above it pick up its motion and swirl in a growing, roaring, thundering hurricane. Before we can do anything, it reaches for the sky, thickening in a giant cloud. Then holes open in the clouds, each like a reverse whirlpool of buzzing, roaring air, in the most magnificent storm ever seen on Mars.

How complicated and unpredictable the machinery of life really is!

<effect>Mars has lost <resource(terr_atmo_loss,'AtmosphereTP')>, and gained <resource(terr_temp_gain,'TemperatureTP')> and <resource(terr_water_gain,'WaterTP')>.
Dust Storm incoming.

column2:
"Commander, meet our guest from the Great Salt Lake! Isn't she beautiful?"

There is a small monster in the jar - apparently, a brine shrimp. Your advisor jabbers enthusiastically about this creature, which seems to be naturally adapted to... well, everything. Low oxygen? No problem, it's a hemoglobin cheater. Cold water? Well okay, its eggs can survive the temperature of liquid air. Salty water? It's like, "whoa, add some toxins to spice it up, I'll go get my girl".

Looks like the brine shrimps can be among the first animal species we can introduce to Mars.
column3:
"Commander, meet our guest from the Great Salt Lake! Isn't she beautiful?"

No problem, it's a hemoglobin cheater. Cold water? Well okay, its eggs can survive the temperature of liquid air. Salty water? It's like, "whoa, add some toxins to spice it up, I'll go get my girl".

column2: Go on then, take a rocket and spread those ugly creatures on Mars!
column3: Go on then, take a rocket and spread those ugly creatures on Mars!

column2: We'll name a random Dome after the Martian Shrimp. Let them do the job!
column3: We'll name a random Dome after the Martian Shrimp. Let them do the job!
column4: Nazwiemy jedną z kopuł imieniem tej krewetki. Niech jej mieszkańcy wykonają niezbędną robotę!

column3: We can develop a low-G shrimp better adapted to the conditions on Mars.

column2: No thanks. These creatures give me nightmares.
column3: No thanks. These creatures give me nightmares.
column4: Nie, dziękuję. Takie potwory śnią mi się w koszmarach.

column2:
The rocket returned after successfully spreading brine shrimps throughout the cold salty lakes of the Red Planet.

<effect>Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg_mid,'VegetationTP')>.

column2:
The terraforming expert leads you to a small brine pool not far from your Dome. "Commander, see for yourself! They're so cute!". 

With a closer look, you observe scores of creatures which crawl, swim and jump in and out of the water like some ugly grasshoppers.

<effect>Mars has gained <resource(terr_veg_big,'VegetationTP')>.

column2: Ugh, um, they look okay, I guess.
column3: Ugh, um, they look okay, I guess.
column4: Uch, wyglądają, no, w sumie, nieźle.

column2: The things I do for terraforming Mars.
column3: The things I do for terraforming Mars.
column4: Co ja muszę znosić dla terraformowania Marsa.

column2: The Terraforming field deals with Mars' global Atmosphere, Temperature, Water and Vegetation, Special Projects, production of Seeds, planting of different vegetation types and landscaping.
column3: Тэрафарміраваньне зьвязана з Марсіянскімі Атмасфэрай, Тэмпэратурай, Вадой і Расьліннасьцьцю, Спэцыяльнымі Праектамі, вытворчасьцьцю Насеньня, пасадкай рознай расьліннасьці й дызайну краявіду.
column4: Dziedzina terraformingu wiąże się z atmosferą, temperaturą, wodą i roślinnością na Marsie, projektami specjalnymi, produkcją nasion, sadzeniem roślin różnego typu i kształtowaniem krajobrazu.

column2:
Instantly gain <param1>% in all terraforming parameters.

<grey>"Is such a thing even possible? Yes, it is!" 
<right>Giorgio A. Tsoukalos</grey><left>
column3:
Усе параметры тэрафарміраваньня ігненна атрымліваюць <param1>%.

<grey>"Гэта ўвогуле магчыма? Так!" 
<right>Джорджыа А. Цукалас</grey><left>

column2:
Newly grown forests have a chance to spawn Vistas and Research Sites.

<grey>"For in the true nature of things, if we rightly consider, every green tree is far more glorious than if it were made of gold and silver." 
<right>Martin Luther</grey><left>
column3:
Новапасаджаныя лясы маюць шанец стварыць вісты й дасьледчыя мейсцы.

<grey>"Па рэчаіснасьці прыроды, калі мы правільна разважаем, кожнае зялёнае дрэва значна больш слаўнае, за зробленае з золата й срэбра." 
<right>Марцін Лютэр</grey><left>

column2:
Lake pumps are self-sufficient and no longer need to be supplied with Water.

<grey>"Water is a very good servant, but it is a cruel master." 
<right>C.G.D. Roberts</grey><left>
column3:
Помпы для азёр самадастатковы й больш не патраюць забесьпячэньне вадой.

<grey>"Вада - вельмі добры слуга, але жорсткі гаспадар." 
<right>Ч. Д. Д. Робертс</grey><left>

column2:
Landscaping projects progress without the need of Drones and are generally faster.

<grey>"Nothing is built on stone; all is built on sand, but we must build as if the sand were stone." 
<right>Jorge Luis Borges</grey><left>
column3:
Праэкты краявіду могуць выконвацца без удзелу дронаў і даволі хутка.

<grey>"Жадны будынак з каменю: усё збудована з пяску, але мусімы будаваць нібы пясок ёсьць камень." 
<right>Хорхе Луіс Борхес</grey><left>

column2:
Halves the Water<icon_WaterTP_alt> and the Temperature<icon_TemperatureTP_alt> requirements of grass, bushes, trees and Open Farm crops.

<grey>"The leaves and the light are one." 
<right>Albert Einstein</grey><left>
column3:
Удвая зьніжае патрабаваньне вады <icon_WaterTP_alt> і тэмпературы<icon_TemperatureTP_alt> для травы, кустоў, дрэў і вонкавых фэрм.
<grey>"Лісьце й сьвятло - адно цэлае." 
<right>Альберт Эйнштэйн</grey><left>

column2: Genetically engineer a species of a shrimp which can benefit from Mars' low gravity and gain the ability to crawl and jump to the nearest water source on its own. Gain <resource(3000,'VegetationTP')>.
column3: Genetically engineer a species of a shrimp which can benefit from Mars' low gravity and gain the ability to crawl and jump to the nearest water source on its own. Gain <resource(3000,'VegetationTP')>.
column4: Przygotowanie genetyczne gatunku krewetki, który będzie się dobrze czuć w niskiej grawitacji Marsa i uzyska zdolność samodzielnego pełzania i przeskakiwania do pobliskich zbiorników wodnych. Uzyskujesz <resource(3000,'VegetationTP')>.

column2: Fuel Refineries consume 50% more Water and produce 10% more Fuel, contributing to planetary Atmosphere by <resource(15,'AtmosphereTP')> per Sol for every working Fuel Refinery.
column3: Заводы паліва спажываюць на 50% больш вады й выпрацоўваюць на 10% больш паліву, паляпшае атмасфэоу плянеты на <resource(15,'AtmosphereTP')> у Сол за кожны працуюшчы завод паліву.
column4: Wytwórnie paliwa zużywają o 50% więcej wody i wytwarzają o 10% więcej paliwa oraz zwiększają poziom atmosfery planetarnej o <resource(15,'AtmosphereTP')> na sola za każdą działającą wytwórnię.

column2: Fuel Refineries consume 100% more Water and produce 25% more Fuel, contributing to planetary Atmosphere by <resource(30,'AtmosphereTP')> per Sol for every working Fuel Refinery.
column3: Заводы паліва спажывае на 100% больш вады й выпрацоўваюць на 25% больш паліву, паляпшае атмасфэру палнеты на <resource(30,'AtmosphereTP')> у Сол за кожны працуюшчы завод паліву.
column4: Wytwórnie paliwa zużywają o 100% więcej wody i wytwarzają o 25% więcej paliwa oraz zwiększają poziom atmosfery planetarnej o <resource(30,'AtmosphereTP')> na sola za każdą działającą wytwórnię.

column2: Shuttle Hubs consume 50% more Fuel and Shuttles move 10% faster, contributing to planetary Temperature by <resource(5,'TemperatureTP')> per Sol for every Shuttle in flight.
column3: ЦК Шатлаў спажывае на 50% больш паліву й шатлы рухаюцца на 10% шыбчэй, паляпшае тэмпературу плянеты на <resource(5,'TemperatureTP')> у Сол за кожны шатл у палёце.
column4: Węzły wahadłowców zużywają o 50% więcej paliwa, a wahadłowce poruszają się o 10% szybciej, zwiększając temperaturę planetarną o <resource(5,'TemperatureTP')> na sola za każdy latający wahadłowiec.

column2: Shuttle Hubs consume 100% more Fuel and Shuttles move 25% faster, contributing to planetary Temperature by <resource(10,'TemperatureTP')> per Sol for every Shuttle in flight.
column3: ЦК Шатлаў спажывае на 100% больш паліву й шатлы рухаюцца на 25% шыбчэй, паляпшае тэмпературу плянеты на <resource(10,'TemperatureTP')> у Сол за кожны шатл у палёце.
column4: Węzły wahadłowców zużywają o 100% więcej paliwa, a wahadłowce poruszają się o 25% szybciej, zwiększając temperaturę planetarną o <resource(10,'TemperatureTP')> na sola za każdy latający wahadłowiec.

column2:
Research the life improving formula discovered by one of our colonists and verify its presumed qualities. 
As a side effect, one may expect a 5% boost in the field of Biotech.
column3:
Research the life improving formula discovered by one of our colonists and verify its presumed qualities. 
As a side effect, one may expect a 5% boost in the field of Biotech.

column2: New Resource: Seeds - used to plant vegetation on Mars. Can be brought from Earth or grown in Farms and Hydroponic Farms. New Building: Forestation Plant () - plants vegetation around it-self at the cost of Seeds. Increases local Soil Quality and improves global Vegetation , "Vegetation is the basic instrument the creator uses to set all of nature in motion." Antoine Lavoisier
column3: Новы рэсурс: Насеньне - выкарыстоўваецца для пасадкі расьліннасьці на Марсе. Яго можна прывезьці зь Зямлі або вырасьціць на фэрмах і гідрапонных фэрмах. Новы будынак: Лесапасадка () - саджае расьліннасьць вакол сябе за кошт насеньня. Гэта павышае якасьць мясцовай глебы й паляпшае глабальную расьліннасьць , "Расьліннасьць - гэта асноўны інструмент, з дапамогай якога творца прыводзіць у рух усю прыроду." Антуан Лавуазье

column2: Unlocks the construction of RC Dozer - a vehicle that can be used for landscaping projects. RC Dozers can also be ordered from Earth. "There's something about taking a plow and breaking new ground. It gives you energy." Ken Kesey
column3: Адкрывае будаўніцтва РК Бульдозера - марсаход, што можа працаваць з праэктамі краявіду. РК Бульдозер таксама магчыма замовіць зь Зямлі. "Ёсць нешта ў тым, каб узяць плуг і паараць зямлю. Гэта дае вам энэргію." Кен Кізі

column2: Discover new Planetary Anomalies. "Until you cross the bridge of your insecurities, you can’t begin to explore your possibilities." Tim Fargo
column3: Адкрывае новых Плянетарных анамалій. "Пакуль вы не пяройдзеце мост сваёй няўпэўненасьці, вы ня зможаце пачаць дасьледаваць свае магчымасьці." Цім Фарго

column2: Drones work faster on landscaping projects. "If geometry is dressed in a suit coat, topology dons jeans and a T-shirt." David S. Richeson
column3: Дроны працуюць хутчэй над праэктамі краявіду. "Калі геяметрыя апранута ў паліто, то тапалёгія апранае джынсы й цішотку." Дэвід С. Рычэсан

column2: New Building: GHG Factory () - burns Fuel to increase the Temperature of Mars, using greenhouse gases. "You could warm Mars up, over time, with greenhouse gases." Elon Musk
column3: Новы будынак: ПГ Завод () - спальвае паліва для павялячэньня тэмпэратуры Марсу, праз парніковыя газы. "Вы можаце разагрэць Марс з часам парніковымі газамі." Ілон Маск

column2: Get a one-time subsidy of Funding from your sponsor. "Wisdom outweighs any wealth." Sophocles
column3: Атрымаць аднаразовую субсідыю ў памеры фінансаваньня ад вашага фундатару. "Мудрасць пераважвае любое багацьце." Сафокл

column2: Raising the ground via landscaping costs less Waste Rock. Lowering ground via landscaping produces more Waste Rock. "We can look out on an alien landscape that no one has seen before and find it beautiful." David Grinspoon
column3: Падыманьне рэльефу ў Дызайне краявіду каштуе менш пустой пароды. Паніжэньне рэльефу ў Дызайне краявіду вырабляе больш пустой пароды. "Мы можам глядзець на іншаплянетны краявід, якога ніхто раней ня бачыў, і лічыць яго прыгожым." Дэвід Грынспун

column2: Unlocks the Import Greenhouse Gases (improves Atmosphere ) and Capture Ice Asteroids (improves Water ) special projects, accessible via the Planetary View. "If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else." Booker T. Washington
column3: Адкрывае спэцыяльныя праэкты: Імпарт парніковых газаў (паляпшае атмасфэру ) і Захоп ледзянога астэроіду (паляпшае ваду ), якія даступны ў Аглядзе плянеты. "Калі вы хочаце падняць сябе, падніміце кагосьці іншага." Букер Т. Вашынгтон

column2:
Vegetation grows <param1>% faster.

<grey>"Like people, plants respond to extra attention." 
<right>H. Peter Loewer</grey><left>
column3:
Расьлінасьць расьце на <param1>% хутчэй.

<grey>"Як і людзі, расьліны рэагуюць на дадатковую ўвагу." 
<right>Х. Пітэр Лёвер</grey><left>

column2: Unlocks the creation of artificial lakes via landscaping. Evaporating water improves local Soil Quality and Water of Mars. "The little lake you love is the biggest ocean for you!" Mehmet Murat ildan
column3: Адкрывае стварэньне штучных азёр у краявідзе. Выпарэнне вады паляпшае мясцовую глебу й ваду Марсу. "Маленькае возера, якое вы любіце, для вас самы вялікі акіян!" Мехмет Мурат Ільдан

column2: Unlocks planting of Bushes and Trees in Forestation Plants. Fully-grown Bushes and Trees are harvested for Seeds by Drones. "Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven." Rabindranath Tagore
column3: Адкрывае пасадку Кустоў і Дрэў у лесапасадках. Поўнарослыя кусты й дрэвы зьбіраюць на насеньне дронамі. "Дрэвы - гэта бясконцыя намаганьні Зямлі размаўляць са слухаючымі нябёсамі." Рабіндранат Тагор

column2: Wonder: Carbonate Processor () - improves the Atmosphere of Mars by burning Waste Rock. "When fire is applied to a stone it cracks."
column3: Цуд: Вытворца карбону () - паляпшае атмасфэру Марсу праз літаваньне пустой пароды. "Калі да каменю паднесьці агонь, ён трэскаецца."

column2: Tourists pay % more Funding when going back to Earth. Receive Tourist applicants. "People don’t take trips, trips take people." John Steinbeck
column3: Турысты плацяць больш на % калі вяртаюцца да Зямлі. Атрымаць больш кандыдатаў турыстаў. "Не людзі бяруць паездкі, а паездкі бяруць людзей." Джон Стэйнбек
column4: Turyści płacą o % więcej funduszy przy powrocie na Ziemię. Otrzymasz ochotników-turystów. „Ludzie nie wyruszają w podróż, to podróż wyrusza w człowieka”. John Steinbeck

column2: New Building: Open Farm () - plants edible crops at the cost of Seeds. Fully-grown plants are harvested for Food by Drones. "If the amount of hours spent on FarmVille were spent on actual farming, imagine what we could achieve." Adam Dell
column3: Новы будынак: Адкрытыя фэрмы () - садзіць ядомыя культуры за кошт насеньня. Поўнарослыя расьліны зьбіраюць як ежу з дапамогай дронаў. "Калі б колькасьць гадзін, праведзеных у FarmVille, была выдаткавана на сапраўдную фэрму, уявіце, чаго б мы маглі дасягнуць." Адам Дэл

column2: Wonder: Magnetic Field Generator () - decreases the loss of Atmosphere due to lack of magnetic field. "Magnetism, as you recall from physics class, is a powerful force that causes certain items to be attracted to refrigerators." Dave Barry
column3: Цуд: Генератар магнітычнага полю () - памяншае страту атмасфэры з-за бракаваньня магнэтычнага полю. "Магнетызм, як вы памятаеце з урока фізікі, - гэта магутная сіла, якая прымушае некаторыя прадметы прыцягвацца да лядоўні." Дэйв Бары

column2: Wonder: Core Heat Convector () - improves the Temperature of Mars gradually. Consumes Water. "If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it." Lucy Larcom
column3: Цуд: Канвэктар Ядру () - паляпшае тэмпературу Марсу паступова. Спажывае ваду. "Калі сьвет здаецца вам халодным, распальце вогнішчы, каб сагрэць яго." Люсі Ларком

column2: Unlocks the Melt the Polar Caps (improves Water ) special project, accessible via the Planetary View. "This will be the first of a thousand worlds that we will give life to. For we are gods, and we are lonely, so we shall create." Adrian Tchaikovsky, Children of Time
column3: Адкрывае спэцыяльны праэкт Расплавіць палярныя шапкі (паляпшае ваду ), які даступны ў Аглядзе плянеты. "Гэта будзе першы з тысячы сьветаў, якім мы дамо жыццё. Бо мы багі, і мы самотныя, таму мы будзем ствараць." Адрыян Чайкоўскі «Дзеці часу»

column2: GHG Factory, Core Heat Convector, Magnetic Field Generator and Carbonate Processor gain Amplify upgrade, which improves their performance at the cost of increased Power consumption. "It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan." Eleanor Roosevelt
column3: ПГ Завод, Канвэктар ядру, Генератар магнітычнага полю й Вытворца карбону могуць быць Узмацнены, што павялічвае вытворчасьць, але таксама павялічвае спажываньне энэргіі. "На жаданьне патрабуецца столькі ж энэргіі, колькі й на планаваньне." Элеанора Рузвельт

column2: Unlocks the Launch Space Mirror (improves Temperature) and Launch Magnetic Shield (decreases loss of Atmosphere ) special projects, accessible via the Planetary View. "Wherever you go, no matter what the weather, always bring your own sunshine." Anthony J. D'Angelo
column3: Адкрывае спэцыяльныя праэкты: Запуск касьмічнага люстэрка (паляпшае тэмпературу) і Запуск магнітнага шчыту (памяншае страту атмасфэры), якія даступны ў Аглядзе плянеты. "Куды б вы не пайшлі, незалежна ад надвор'я, бярыце з сабой сваё сонца." Энтані Дж. Д'Анджэла

column2: Unlocks the Seed Vegetation (improves Vegetation ) and Cloud Seeding (improves Water ) special projects, accessible via the Planetary View. "The winds of grace are always blowing, but you have to raise the sail." Ramakrishna
column3: Адкрывае спэцыяльныя праэкты: Насенная расьліннасьць (паляпшае расьліннасьць) і Воблачны пасеў (паляпшае ваду), якія даступны ў Аглядзе плянеты. "Вятры ласкі заўсёды дзьмуць, але трэба падняць ветразь." Рамакрышна

column2: Represents the density and composition of the Martian atmosphere. The higher this parameter is, the more Earth-like the atmospheric pressure, Oxygen levels and cloud generation are.The improving Atmosphere decreases the severity of Dust Storms and Meteor Storms and creates environmental conditions for Toxic Rains and clear water Rains to occur.Atmosphere applies terraforming boost to the Power production of Wind Turbines and to the Oxygen production of MOXIEs. Decreases the Power production of Solar Panels.At maximum improvement, the atmosphere of Mars becomes breathable rendering domes and pressure suits obsolete.
column3: Уяўляе шчыльнасьць і склад атмасферы Марсу. Чым вышэй гэты параметр, тым больш атмасферны ціск, узровень тлёну й ўтварэньне аблокоў подобныя на Зямны.Паляпшэньне атмасфэры памяншае вастрыню Пясчаных бур і Метэорных бур, стварае экалагічныя ўмовы каб адбываліся Атрутныя дажджы й Чыстыя дажджы.Шчыльная атмасфэра ўзмацняе вытворчасьць энэргіі Ветравых турбін і вытворчасьць тлёну ў МЭРТах. Зьмяншае вытворчасьць энэргіі ў Сонечных панэляў.Пры максімальным паляпшэньні, атмасфэра Марсу становіцца прыдатнай да дыханьня, таму купалы й скафандры больш не патрэбны.
column4: Reprezentuje gęstość i skład marsjańskiej atmosfery. Im wyższa wartość parametru, tym bardziej jest ona podobna do ziemskiej pod względem ciśnienia atmosferycznego, zawartości tlenu i tworzenia chmur.Im lepsza atmosfera, tym słabsze są burze pyłowe i burze meteorytowe. Atmosfera tworzy środowisko umożliwiające trujące deszcze i deszcze czystej wody.Atmosfera daje premię od terraformingu do produkcji energii przez turbiny wiatrowe i produkcji tlenu przez MAGETLEN-y. Zmniejsza produkcję energii przez panele słoneczne.Przy maksymalnym stopniu ulepszenia atmosfera Marsa staje się zdatna do oddychania, przez co hermetyczne kopuły i skafandry ciśnieniowe stają się zbędne.

column2: Represents the global surface temperature on Mars. The higher this parameter is, the more favorable the conditions for Earth-like life are.The improving Temperature decreases the severity of Cold Wave and creates environmental conditions for Toxic Rains and clear water Rains to occur.Increased Temperature is required for liquid water to be present on the surface of Mars and in lakes. High enough Temperatures are also paramount for the habitability of the Martian surface and to be able to have open-air Domes.
column3: Уяўляе глабальную тэмпэратуру паверхні Марсу. Чым вышэй гэты параметр, тым больш спрыяльныя ўмовы для жыцця як на Зямлі.Павышэньне тэмпэратуры памяншае вастрыню Халодных хавляў, стварае экалагічныя ўмовы каб адбываліся Атрутныя дажджы й Чыстыя дажджы.Павышэньне тэмпературы патрэбна каб на паверхні Марсу з'явідася Вадкая вада й ў азёрах. Дастаткова высокая тэмпература таксама мае першараднае значэньне для таго, каб паверхня Марсу была прыдатнай для пражываньня й каб былі адкрытыя Купалы.
column4: Odpowiada globalnej temperaturze na powierzchni Marsa. Im wyższa wartość parametru, tym bardziej środowisko sprzyja życiu podobnemu do ziemskiego.Zwiększenie temperatury zmniejsza intensywność fal zimna i tworzy środowisko umożliwiające trujące deszcze i deszcze czystej wody.Zwiększona temperatura jest niezbędna dla występowania ciekłej wody na powierzchni Marsa i w jeziorach. Odpowiednio wysokie temperatury są też niezbędne dla możliwości zamieszkania powierzchni Marsa i otwarcia kopuł.

column2: Represents the spreading and diversity of vegetation and bacterial life on a planetary scale. The higher this parameter is, the more Mars looks like the tundra biome back on Earth, with the ultimate goal to become a quite harsh, yet habitable second home for Humanity.The improving Vegetation increases the likelihood that plants will replicate and spread.As wild vegetation improves, sporadic vegetation booms will occur. Increased concentration of seeds in the wind causes lichen, grass, bushes or trees to spread throughout the colony.
column3: Уяўляе распаўсюджваньне й разнастайнасьць расьліннасьці й бактэрыяльнага жыцьця ў плянетарным маштабе. Чым вышэй гэты параметр, тым больш Марс падобны на біём тундры на Зямлі, канчатковая мэта якой - стаць даволі суровым, але прыдатным для жыцьця для чалавецтва.Паляпшэньне расьліннасьці павялічвае верагоднасьць размнажэньня й распаўсюджваньня расьлін.As wild vegetation improves, sporadic vegetation booms will occur. Increased concentration of seeds in the wind causes lichen, grass, bushes or trees to spread throughout the colony.
column4: Reprezentuje rozpowszechnienie i zróżnicowanie życia bakteryjnego i roślinnego w skali planetarnej. Im wyższa wartość parametru, tym bardziej Mars będzie wyglądać jak ziemska tundra, aby ostatecznie stać się dość surowym, ale nadającym się do zamieszkania drugim domem dla ludzkości.Wzrost poziomu roślinności zwiększa prawdopodobieństwo rozmnażania się i rozprzestrzeniania roślin.W miarę rozwoju dzikiej roślinności następować będą okresy jej nagłego namnażania się.Zwiększona koncentracja nasion w powietrzu sprawi, że porosty, trawa, krzewy i drzewa rozprzestrzenią się po kolonii.

column2: Represents the quality and volume of surface water on Mars. The higher this parameter is, the more and larger water bodies will appear on Mars: lakes, seas and oceans.The improving Water creates environmental conditions for Toxic Rains and clear water Rains to occur.Water applies terraforming boost to the Water production of Moisture Vaporators.
column3: Уяўляе якасьць і аб'ём паверхневых вод на Марсе. Чым вышэй гэты параметр, тым больш і больш буйных вадаёмаў будзе з'яўляцца на Марсе: азёры, моры й акіяны.Павышэньне вады стварае экалагічныя ўмовы каб адбываліся Атрутныя дажджы й Чыстыя дажджы.Вада ўзмацняе вытворчасьць вады ў Выпарніках вільгаці.
column4: Przedstawia jakość i objętość wody powierzchniowej na Marsie. Im wyższa wartość parametru, tym więcej zbiorników wodnych będzie się pojawiać na Marsie – jezior, mórz i oceanów – i tym większe one będą.Wzrost ilości wody tworzy środowisko umożliwiające trujące deszcze i deszcze czystej wody.Woda daje premię od terraformingu do produkcji wody przez oddzielacze wilgoci.

column2: Bushes produce small amount of Seeds when fully-grown.
column3: Bushes produce small amount of Seeds when fully-grown.
column4: Krzewy po wyrośnięciu wytwarzają niewielką ilość nasion.

column2: Lichen improve local Soil Quality. They don't require Soil Quality to grow but do not spread on their own.
column3: Lichen improve local Soil Quality. They don't require Soil Quality to grow but do not spread on their own.
column4: Porosty poprawiają miejscową jakość gleby. Nie wymagają określonej jakości gleby, ale same się nie rozprzestrzeniają.

column2: Mixed Trees produce very large amount of Seeds when fully-grown.
column3: Mixed Trees produce very large amount of Seeds when fully-grown.
column4: Drzewa mieszane wytwarzają po wyrośnięciu bardzo dużą ilość nasion.

column2: Trees produce large amount of Seeds when fully-grown.
column3: Trees produce large amount of Seeds when fully-grown.
column4: Drzewa wytwarzają po wyrośnięciu dużą ilość nasion.

column2: Herbs produce small amount of Food. They grow quickly and slightly improve the local Soil Quality.
column3: Herbs produce small amount of Food. They grow quickly and slightly improve the local Soil Quality.
column4: Zioła wytwarzają niewielką ilość żywności. Rosną szybko i nieco poprawiają miejscową jakość gleby.

column2: Potatoes grow slowly but give a plentiful harvest. They significantly decrease the local Soil Quality, slowing down the growing of following crops.
column3: Potatoes grow slowly but give a plentiful harvest. They significantly decrease the local Soil Quality, slowing down the growing of following crops.
column4: Ziemniaki rosną powoli, ale dają obfite plony. Znacznie obniżają miejscową jakość gleby, co spowalnia wzrost następnych upraw.

column2: Cover Crops grow slowly and have very low yield on harvest. They significantly increase the local Soil Quality, improving the growth time of following crops.
column3: Cover Crops grow slowly and have very low yield on harvest. They significantly increase the local Soil Quality, improving the growth time of following crops.
column4: Rośliny okrywowe rosną powoli i dają bardzo słabe plony. Znacznie poprawiają miejscową jakość gleby, skracając czas rośnięcia następnych upraw.

column2: Leaf Crops grow relatively quickly and are a good source of Food. They slightly decrease the local Soil Quality.
column3: Leaf Crops grow relatively quickly and are a good source of Food. They slightly decrease the local Soil Quality.
column4: Uprawy liściaste rosną względnie szybko i są dobrym źródłem żywności. Lekko obniżają miejscową jakość gleby.

column2: Wheat has medium growth time and average Food yields.
column3: Wheat has medium growth time and average Food yields.
column4: Pszenica ma średni czas rośnięcia i daje przeciętne plony.

column2: Contributes to the currently selected research project: . The following stats are summary of the predicted Research production for the current Sol. Research per Sol Lifetime research
column3: Contributes to the currently selected research project: . The following stats are summary of the predicted Research production for the current Сол. Research per Сол Lifetime research

column2: Summary of the base terraforming effect of this building and the expected effect of all similar buildings. As long as this building is supplied with the required resources and working, it will gradually change one of the planetary parameters: Atmosphere, Temperature, Water or Vegetation.
column3: Summary of the base terraforming effect of this building and the expected effect of all similar buildings. As long as this building is supplied with the required resources and working, it will gradually change one of the planetary parameters: Atmosphere, Temperature, Water or Vegetation.
column4: Podsumowanie podstawowego efektu terraformującego tego budynku i oczekiwanych efektów wszystkich podobnych budynków. Jeśli budynek jest zaopatrywany w wymagane zasoby i działa, stopniowo zmienia jeden z parametrów planetarnych: atmosferę, temperaturę, wodę lub roślinność.

column2: As the Martian atmosphere increasingly thickens, more and more of it gets lost due to the lack of a magnetic field. Stationary Magnetic Field Generators and Magnetic Shields launched into orbit reduce this loss of Atmosphere.
column3: As the Martian atmosphere increasingly thickens, more and more of it gets lost due to the lack of a magnetic field. Stationary Magnetic Field Generators and Magnetic Shields launched into orbit reduce this loss of Atmosphere.
column4: W miarę gęstnienia marsjańskiej atmosfery coraz większa jej część będzie tracona z powodu braku pola magnetycznego. Stacjonarne generatory pola magnetycznego i osłony magnetyczne wprowadzone na orbitę zmniejszają utratę atmosfery.

column2: Display visual representation of the underlying Soil Quality.
column3: Display visual representation of the underlying Soil Quality.
column4: Wyświetla informację graficzną o jakości gleby.

column2: The area in which Seeds will be spread in an attempt to plant the selected vegetation types.<newline><newline>Plantation area<right><SelectionRadiusScale> hexes
column3: The area in which Seeds will be spread in an attempt to plant the selected vegetation types.<newline><newline>Plantation area<right><SelectionRadiusScale> hexes
column4: Obszar, na którym zostaną rozsiane nasiona przy próbie zasadzenia roślinności wybranego typu.<newline><newline>Obszar sadzenia<right><SelectionRadiusScale> pola/pól

column2: Summary of the soil quality in range of this building. Most vegetation types require more or less fertile land to grow and spread seeds. The soil quality is improved by purewater rain and new vegetation. Acid rains and some plants may decrese it.
column3: Summary of the soil quality in range of this building. Most vegetation types require more or less fertile land to grow and spread seeds. The soil quality is improved by purewater rain and new vegetation. Acid rains and some plants may decrese it.
column4: Podsumowanie jakości gleby w zasięgu tego budynku. Większość typów roślinności wymaga mniej lub bardziej żyznej ziemi, aby mogły rosnąć i rozsiewać nasiona. Jakość gleby jest poprawiana przez deszcze czystej wody i nową roślinność. Kwaśne deszcze i niektóre rośliny mogą ją obniżać.

column2: The amount of resources which can be harvested from vegetation in this building's range. Harvesting is a low priority operation and is done by idling Drones.
column3: The amount of resources which can be harvested from vegetation in this building's range. Harvesting is a low priority operation and is done by idling Drones.
column4: Ilość zasobów, które można zebrać z roślinności w zasięgu tego budynku. Zbieranie plonów jest operacją o niskim priorytecie i jest wykonywane przez bezczynne drony.

column2: Green Planet is the second expansion of Surviving Mars, allowing late-game terraforming of your sector and the entire Mars.
column3: Green Planet is the second expansion of Surviving Mars, allowing late-game terraforming of your sector and the entire Mars.
column4: „Zielona Planeta” jest drugim dodatkiem dla gry Surviving Mars, umożliwiającym terraformowanie sektora gracza i całego Marsa w późnej fazie rozgrywki.

column2: "All the gold which is under or upon the earth is not enough to give in exchange for virtue."<newline><right> - Plato
column3: "Усяго золата, што знаходзіцца ў зямлі ці на ёй, недастаткова, каб аддаць яе ў абмен на цноту."<newline><right> - Плато
column4: „Całe złoto na ziemi i pod nią nie dorównuje wartością cnocie”.<newline><right> - Platon

column2: "To light a candle is to cast a shadow."<newline><right>- Ursula K. Le Guin
column3: "Запаліць сьвячу – гэта кінуць цень."<newline><right>- Урсула К. Ле Гуін
column4: „Zapalić świecę oznacza rzucić cień”.<newline><right>- Ursula K. Le Guin

column2: An anomalous object emitting a mysterious light.
column3: An anomalous object emitting a mysterious light.

column2: "The gods do not protect fools. Fools are protected by more capable fools."<newline><right>- Larry Niven
column3: "Дурняў не ахоўваюць багі. Дурняў ахоўваюць больш здольныя дурні."<newline><right>- Ларры Нівен
column4: „Bogowie nie chronią głupców. Głupców chronią zdolniejsi głupcy”.<newline><right>- Larry Niven

column2: Anomalous alien object with unspecified origin.
column3: Anomalous alien object with unspecified origin.

column2: Uses Water to create a potential target for Wisps. The Wisps will be held inside during the night.
column3: Uses Water to create a potential target for Wisps. The Wisps will be held inside during the night.
column4: Zużywa wodę, by stać się potencjalnym celem ogników. Ogniki będą tu przetrzymywane w nocy.

column2: When we tried to scan one of the sectors, our sensors went blind. Upon closer inspection we discovered that the source of the interference was a mysterious crystalline entity. It’s huge, how could we have missed it?
column3: When we tried to scan one of the sectors, our sensors went blind. Upon closer inspection we discovered that the source of the interference was a mysterious crystalline entity. It’s huge, how could we have missed it?
column4: Gdy próbowaliśmy przeskanować jeden z sektorów, nasze czujniki oślepły. Po bliższym badaniu odkryliśmy, że źródłem zakłóceń był pewien tajemniczy krystaliczny obiekt. Jest ogromny - jak mogliśmy go przegapić?

column2: The dark crystal is just standing there, refracting the light in a peculiar way. Intense energy vortices around the entity cause vibrations in the atmosphere and give birth to Electrostatic Dust Devils. Some of our scientists proposed that the crystals have energy-manipulating properties and so were able to obfuscate their presence in the area despite their proportions. Of course, all of this is just a hypothesis – we need more research to reach a conclusion. A peculiar Alien Crystal has been revealed in Sector . The sector can’t be scanned for now. The Crystalline Entity Properties tech has become available. Research it to gain more insight on the mystery.
column3: The dark crystal is just standing there, refracting the light in a peculiar way. Intense energy vortices around the entity cause vibrations in the atmosphere and give birth to Electrostatic Dust Devils. Some of our scientists proposed that the crystals have energy-manipulating properties and so were able to obfuscate their presence in the area despite their proportions. Of course, all of this is just a hypothesis – we need more research to reach a conclusion. A peculiar Alien Crystal has been revealed in Sector . The sector can’t be scanned for now. The Crystalline Entity Properties tech has become available. Research it to gain more insight on the mystery.

column2: Maintain caution around the crystals until we know more.
column3: Maintain caution around the crystals until we know more.
column4: W okolicy kryształów należy zachować ostrożność, dopóki nie dowiemy się więcej.

column2: We have discovered a mysterious alien crystal in one of the map sectors. It’s blocking our scanners somehow. We need to complete the research Crystalline Entity Properties in order to know more.
column3: We have discovered a mysterious alien crystal in one of the map sectors. It’s blocking our scanners somehow. We need to complete the research Crystalline Entity Properties in order to know more.
column4: W jednym z sektorów odkryliśmy tajemniczy kosmiczny kryształ. W jakiś sposób blokuje on nasze skanery. Aby dowiedzieć się więcej, musimy zbadać technologię „Właściwości krystalicznego obiektu”.

column2: The bizarre alien crystals appear to soak up all forms of waves directed at them. Our team suggests that if we feed enough energy to the entities, their physical properties would change dramatically.
column3: The bizarre alien crystals appear to soak up all forms of waves directed at them. Our team suggests that if we feed enough energy to the entities, their physical properties would change dramatically.
column4: Dziwaczne kosmiczne kryształy wchłaniają wszystkie postacie fal, którymi są bombardowane. Nasz zespół badawczy sugeruje, że jeśli nasycimy te obiekty wystarczającą ilością energii, ich właściwości fizyczne drastycznie się zmienią.

column2:
We are unable to predict the effects of such an action but the Chiefs of Staff suggest that this could be the only logical way of finding out what’s going on.

<effect>Crystals can be fed energy. When powered up completely, their properties will change.
column3:
We are unable to predict the effects of such an action but the Chiefs of Staff suggest that this could be the only logical way of finding out what’s going on.

<effect>Crystals can be fed energy. When powered up completely, their properties will change.

column2: We could give it a try… but tread carefully!
column3: We could give it a try… but tread carefully!

column2: Our scientists have completed the Crystalline Entity Properties research project which revealed that the alien crystals can be fed energy via our power grid. Who knows what could happen if we actually provide them with the required energy?
column3: Our scientists have completed the Crystalline Entity Properties research project which revealed that the alien crystals can be fed energy via our power grid. Who knows what could happen if we actually provide them with the required energy?
column4: Nasi naukowcy ukończyli projekt badawczy „Właściwości krystalicznego obiektu”, który pokazał, że kryształy można zasilać elektrycznością z naszej sieci energetycznej. Kto wie, co może się stać, jeśli dostarczymy im odpowiednią ilość energii?

column2: The power flowed through the alien crystal and it started humming with low vibration. The tiny dust devils forming around it dispersed and a ray of light beamed from it towards the stars. Such a magnificent sight!
column3: The power flowed through the alien crystal and it started humming with low vibration. The tiny dust devils forming around it dispersed and a ray of light beamed from it towards the stars. Such a magnificent sight!
column4: Energia przepłynęła przez kosmiczny kryształ, który zaczął cicho buczeć. Powstające wokół niego małe diabły pyłowe rozproszyły się, a z kryształu wystrzelił ku gwiazdom promień światła. Jakiż to wspaniały widok!

column2:
Our sensors went crazy as mathematical sequences started feeding us information about the surrounding area. Immediately, tiny specks of dust started shedding from the outer layer of the crystal. Our analysis indicates that these are filled with various rare metals!

The Chief Scientist is fascinated, to say the least! She suggests that we power up more crystals, but to do it carefully as it appears that the entities are quite susceptible to energy fluctuations which can threaten their integrity. On the other hand, the Tactical Commander suggests that we must torch one of the crystals, crack it open and see what’s inside of it – as usually, he suspects some kind of threat for the colony.

<effect>Powered up crystals instantly reveal their sector and stop emitting Electrostatic Dust Devils. They produce small amounts of Rare Metals over time while powered.

<effect>You can destroy powered-up crystals to instantly gain Research Point rewards.

<hint>Power up more crystals to progress through the Mystery.
column3:
Our sensors went crazy as mathematical sequences started feeding us information about the surrounding area. Immediately, tiny specks of dust started shedding from the outer layer of the crystal. Our analysis indicates that these are filled with various rare metals!

The Chief Scientist is fascinated, to say the least! She suggests that we power up more crystals, but to do it carefully as it appears that the entities are quite susceptible to energy fluctuations which can threaten their integrity. On the other hand, the Tactical Commander suggests that we must torch one of the crystals, crack it open and see what’s inside of it – as usually, he suspects some kind of threat for the colony.

<effect>Powered up crystals instantly reveal their sector and stop emitting Electrostatic Dust Devils. They produce small amounts of Rare Metals over time while powered.

<effect>You can destroy powered-up crystals to instantly gain Research Point rewards.

<hint>Power up more crystals to progress through the Mystery.

column2: The moment we powered up one of the crystals, the Dust Devils in the area stopped and it revealed the sector! On top of that, the crystal started shedding tiny amounts of Rare Metals! Maybe it is a good idea to continue giving them energy!
column3: The moment we powered up one of the crystals, the Dust Devils in the area stopped and it revealed the sector! On top of that, the crystal started shedding tiny amounts of Rare Metals! Maybe it is a good idea to continue giving them energy!
column4: Gdy jeden z kryształów otrzymał odpowiednią ilość energii, w okolicy przestały pojawiać się diabły pyłowe i poznaliśmy natychmiast cały sektor! Co więcej, kryształ zaczął wydzielać drobne ilości rzadkich metali! Być może warto kontynuować zasilanie kryształów!

column2: The crystals appear to be something greater than mere physical anomalies. Some members of our team described them as intelligent entities, as crazy as that sounds.
column3: The crystals appear to be something greater than mere physical anomalies. Some members of our team described them as intelligent entities, as crazy as that sounds.
column4: Kryształy wydają się być czymś więcej niż zwykłą anomalią fizyczną. Niektórzy członkowie naszego zespołu naukowego mówią o nich jak o inteligentnych istotach, choć wygląda to na wariactwo.

column2:
Since the last one we powered up, they began to project a holographic image of something we initially believed to be a star chart. A more thorough examination revealed that they are showing the relative positions of the other crystals we haven’t yet powered up. As weird as it seems, we all get the impression that they urge us to complete the process for the rest of them.

<hint>Power-up all Alien Crystals to complete the mystery.
column3:
Since the last one we powered up, they began to project a holographic image of something we initially believed to be a star chart.
