column2: Make the Martian night a little brighter.
People fantasized about pyramids and obelisks on Mars once. Now we build them, just because we can.
column3: Калісьці людзі фантазіравалі пра піраміды й абеліскі на Марсе. Цяпер мы будуем іх проста таму, што можам.
column4: Ludzie fantazjowali kiedyś o piramidach i obeliskach na Marsie. Teraz sami je budujemy – bo możemy.

column2: "We are an impossibility in an impossible universe."
"In honor of the Founders of Mars."

column4: +<upgrade1_mul_value_1>% do dodatkowej produkcji energii w stanie otwartym

column2: Generates Power. When closed the generator is protected from dust, but produces less Power. Heats the surrounding area when opened.
column3: Вырабляе энэргію. У закрытым стане абаронены ад пылу, але вырабляе менш энэргіі. Калі адкрыты - абагравае навакольле.
column4: Wytwarza energię. W stanie zamkniętym jest chroniony przed pyłem, ale ma zmniejszoną wydajność. W stanie otwartym ogrzewa otoczenie.

column2: +<upgrade1_mul_value_1>% Production as long as the building is supplied with Fuel. If not supplied with Fuel, the building will continue to operate but will lose the bonus.
column3: +<upgrade1_mul_value_1>% Вытворчасьць, пакуль будынак забясьпечваецца палівам. Калі брак паліва, будынак будзе працаваць далей, але бяз бонусу.
column4: +<upgrade1_mul_value_1>% do produkcji, jak długo budynek jest zaopatrywany w paliwo. Przy braku paliwa budynek będzie działać nadal, ale bez premii.

column2: Remote-controlled vehicle that extracts Metals and Rare Metals from underground deposits (but not deep deposits). Drilling wastes 50% of the materials in the deposit.
column3: Радыё-кіраваны марсаход які здабывае мэталы й рэдкія мэталы з радовішч (выключая глыбокападземныя). Губляе 50% рэсурсаў радовішча.
column4: Zdalnie sterowany pojazd, który wydobywa metale i rzadkie metale ze złóż podziemnych (ale nie głębinowych). Wiercenie powoduje zmarnowanie 50% materiału w złożu.

column2: Remote-controlled vehicle that transports, controls and repairs Drones. Acts as a Sensor Tower while idle.
column3: Радыё-кіраваны марсаход які транспартуе, кіруе й рамантуе дронаў. Пад час пакою працуе як Вежа-сканэр.
column4: Zdalnie sterowany pojazd, który steruje dronami, przewozi je i naprawia. W stanie bezczynności działa jak wieżyczka detekcyjna.

column2: Remote-controlled vehicle that transports, controls and repairs Drones. During the day it can gather Power via its solar panels to act as a power producer if connected to a network.
column3: Радыё-кіраваны марсаход які транспартуе, кіруе й рамантуе дронаў. Пад час дню, калі падлучаны да сетцы энэргіі, выпрацоўвае сваёй сонечнай панэлью энэргію.
column4: Zdalnie sterowany pojazd, który steruje dronami, przewozi je i naprawia. Za dnia może wytwarzać energię w swoich bateriach słonecznych i działać jako źródło energii, jeśli będzie podłączony do sieci.

column2: Remote-controlled vehicle that harvests Concrete from deposits, gathers resources from surface deposits and transports resources.
column3: Радыё-кіраваны марсаход які здабывае бэтон з радовішч, зьбірае рэсурсы з паверховых радовішч і транспартуе рэсурсы.
column4: Zdalnie sterowany pojazd, który zbiera cement ze złóż, pozyskuje zasoby ze złóż powierzchniowych i przewozi zasoby.

column2: Remote-controlled vehicle that extracts Metals and Rare Metals from underground deposits (but not deep deposits). Drilling wastes 50% of the materials in the deposit.
column3: Радыё-кіраваны марсаход які здабывае мэталы й рэдкія мэталы з радовішч (выключая глыбокападземныя). Губляе 50% рэсурсаў радовішча.
column4: Zdalnie sterowany pojazd, który wydobywa metale i rzadkie metale ze złóż podziemnych (ale nie głębinowych). Wiercenie powoduje zmarnowanie 50% materiału w złożu.

column2: An automated flying drone controlled by a Drone Hub, Rocket or RC Commander. Gathers resources, constructs buildings and performs maintenance. Doesn't fly during Dust Storms.
column3: Аўтаматызаваны лятаюшчыя дроны, кіруюшчыяся праз ЦК Дронаў, Ракету або РК Камандыру. Зьбірае рэсурсы, будуе й абслугоўвае будынкі. Не лётае падчас пясчаных бур.
column4: Latający dron sterowany przez gniazdo dronów, rakietę lub mobilną bazę. Zbiera zasoby, wznosi budynki i wykonuje konserwację. Nie lata podczas burz pyłowych.

column2: Reveals deposits in the scanned area.
Immediately scans a Sector and the four adjacent Sectors for deposits and anomalies.
column3: Скануе адразу сэктар і чатыры прылеглых на радовішча й анамаліі.
column4: Natychmiastowo skanuje wskazany sektor i cztery sąsiadujące z nim sektory w poszukiwaniu złóż i anomalii.

column2: Generates Power. Heats the surrounding area when opened.
column3: Вырабляе энэргію й сагрвае навакаольле калі адкрыты.
column4: Wytwarza energię. W stanie otwartym ogrzewa okolicę.

column2: Houses and refuels Shuttles that facilitate long-range resource transportation between Depots and resettling of Colonists between Domes.
column3: Размяшчае й запраўляе шатлы, якія транспартуюць рэсурсы на вялікія адлегласьці паміж складамі й перасяляюць каляністаў паміж купаламі.
column4: Garażuje i tankuje wahadłowce umożliwiające dalekosiężny transport zasobów między składami i przesiedlanie kolonistów między kopułami.

column2: A place to meditate and seek meaning beyond the physical world. Visitors recover Sanity.
column3: A place to meditate and seek meaning beyond the physical world. Visitors recover Sanity.
column4: Miejsce medytacji i poszukiwania sensu poza światem doczesnym. Odwiedzający odzyskują zdrowie psychiczne.

column2: An advanced solar array that generates Power during daytime. Does not produce Power during Dust Storms. Requires less maintenance than regular Solar Panels, but can't be closed.
column3: An advanced solar array that generates Power during daytime. Does not produce Power during Dust Storms. Requires less maintenance than regular Solar Panels, but can't be closed.
column4: Zaawansowany zespół paneli słonecznych, który wytwarza energię w trakcie dnia. Nie działa podczas burz pyłowych. Wymaga mniej konserwacji niż zwykłe panele słoneczne, ale nie można go zamknąć.

column2: A fully automated facility that extracts Metals from underground deposits without the need for Colonist workers.<newline><newline>All extractors contaminate nearby buildings with dust.
column3: Цалкам аўтаматызаваная ўстаноўка, што здабывае мэталы з падземных радовішчаў бяз патрэбы ў працаўніках.<newline><newline>Усе экстрактары забруджваюць бліжэйшыя будынкі пылам.
column4: Całkowicie zautomatyzowany obiekt wydobywający metale ze złóż podziemnych, który nie potrzebuje ludzkiej siły roboczej.<newline><newline>Wszystkie ekstraktory zanieczyszczają okoliczne budynki pyłem.

column2: Produces Concrete and does not require a deposit. Consumes Fuel. All extractors contaminate nearby buildings with dust.
column3: Produces Concrete and does not require a deposit. Consumes Fuel. All extractors contaminate nearby buildings with dust.
column4: Wytwarza cement i nie wymaga złoża. Zużywa paliwo. Wszystkie ekstraktory zanieczyszczają okoliczne budynki pyłem.

column2: Generates funding. Working in a corporate environment can be soul-sucking so all workers take Comfort penalties.
column3: Generates funding. Working in a corporate environment can be soul-sucking so all workers take Comfort penalties.
column4: Wytwarza fundusze. Praca dla korporacji może wykańczać nerwowo, więc wszyscy pracownicy otrzymują kary do wygody.

column2: Works on awesome new titles that gamers on Earth and Mars can enjoy. Released titles grant Funding, but profits tend to be unpredictable.
column3: Works on awesome new titles that gamers on Earth and Mars can enjoy. Released titles grant Funding, but profits tend to be unpredictable.
column4: Tworzy wspaniałe nowe gry dla rozrywki graczy na Ziemi i Marsie. Wydane tytuły dają fundusze, jednak trudno przewidzieć wielkość zysku.

column2: Slowly processes Waste Rock into useful construction materials. Produces small amounts of Metals.
column3: Slowly processes Waste Rock into useful construction materials. Produces small amounts of Metals.
column4: Powoli przetwarza odpady skalne na użyteczne materiały budowlane. Produkuje niewielką ilość metali.

column2: Slowly processes Waste Rock, filtering for precious elements. Produces small amounts of Rare Metals.
column3: Slowly processes Waste Rock, filtering for precious elements. Produces small amounts of Rare Metals.
column4: Powoli przetwarza odpady skalne, odfiltrowując cenne pierwiastki. Produkuje niewielką ilość rzadkich metali.

column2: An outside research building dedicated to experimental research in a Low-G environment. The first operational lab provides a permanent tech cost reduction to Physics and Biotech research fields.
column3: An outside research building dedicated to experimental research in a Low-G environment. The first operational lab provides a permanent tech cost reduction to Physics and Biotech research fields.
column4: Zewnętrzny budynek badawczy przeznaczony do eksperymentów w polu zmniejszonego ciążenia. Pierwsze uruchomione laboratorium daje stałe obniżenie kosztów technologicznych w dziedzinie fizyki i biotechnologii.

column2: Money can't buy everything, but it can buy a lot! Colonists can satisfy all their interests here, except medical checks. The service quality is lower than in the more specialized service buildings.
column3: Money can't buy everything, but it can buy a lot! Colonists can satisfy all their interests here, except medical checks. The service quality is lower than in the more specialized service buildings.
column4: Pieniądze szczęścia nie dają, ale można za nie kupić dużo rzeczy! Koloniści mogą tu zaspokajać wszystkie zainteresowania poza potrzebami medycznymi. Jakość usług jest niższa niż w bardziej wyspecjalizowanych budynkach usługowych.

column2: The health benefits of martial arts are unquestionable. Visitors recover Health and may become Fit.
column3: The health benefits of martial arts are unquestionable. Visitors recover Health and may become Fit.
column4: Uprawianie sztuk walki przynosi niewątpliwe korzyści zdrowotne. Odwiedzający odzyskują zdrowie fizyczne i mogą uzyskać sprawność.

column2:
Supply Pods are an alternative way to bring cargo from Earth to Mars. They arrive faster than Rockets, are single use each and may be salvaged once they crash-land at a chosen location. Supply Pods can bring less cargo than a Rocket can as well as just a single Rover.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Landing pods are especially useful during the fledgling phase of the colony because of their relatively low price and short arrival time.
column3:
Капсулы паставак - гэта альтэрнатыўны варыянт дастаўкі грузу зь Зямлі на Марс. Яны прыбываюць хутчэй за ракеты. Аднаразовыя й могуць быць разобраны, як яны ўрэзаліся ў выбраным мейсцы. Капсулы паставак могуць перавозіць менш грузу за ракету, або толькі адзін марсаход.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Капсулы асабліва карысныя на этапе зараджэньня калёніі з-за іх нізкага кошту й кароткага часу прыбыцьця.

column2:
The Japanese Wasp Drones are the workhorse of the Colony. They are tasked with distributing resources, gathering resources from surface deposits, as well as building, maintaining and repairing structures. Their unique trait is that they can fly over obstacles and thus complete their goals regardless of the treacherous Martian terrain.

Wasp Drones would complete most of their tasks autonomously, but only so in the service range of a Drone Controller - either a Drone Hub, a Rocket or RC Commander.

Wasp Drones run on batteries and need to charge up frequently. RC Commanders and Recharge Stations, including the ones that come with the Drone Hub, provide the much needed battery power.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Wasp Drones are agile, yet powerful semi-autonomous robots. Their versatility comes not only from their vast assortment of work tools, but also from their ability to float and quickly traverse over terrain features otherwise inaccessible by other ground-based vehicles.
column3:

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Wasp Drones are agile, yet powerful semi-autonomous robots. Their versatility comes not only from their vast assortment of work tools, but also from their ability to float and quickly traverse over terrain features otherwise inaccessible by other ground-based vehicles.

column2:
The RC Constructor is a remote-controlled vehicle equipped with a cargo hold that can pick up and carry resources from and to various storage units across the surface of Mars. It can set up transport routes and maintain the flow of resources between two points of the map. Another function of the RC Constructor is to gather resources from surface deposits of Metals and Polymers.

The unique feature of the RC Constructor is the ability to construct buildings on its own without the assistance of Drones. It utilizes the resources it carries on board, and it the required amount of resource blocks is delivered to the construction site, it can autonomously finish the building process.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

The agenda of the Indian Colonization Program was to win the space race by doing what they do best – building their own path to victory. The RC Constructor was especially designed with that purpose in mind, to allow the resourceful Commander to quickly develop the growing Colony, setting up robust facilities and freeing valuable drone time.
column3:

column2:
The RC Driller is a unique remote-controlled vehicle developed by the Russian Colonization Program. When ordered to exploit an underground Metals or Rare Metals deposit, it deploys its in-built driller probe and starts extracting the valuable resources from deep below.

While doing so it wastes 50% of the production, but on the other hand it grants access to otherwise hard to get resources without the need of operational Dome and the presence of Colonists nearby. The normal logic for accessing an underground deposit applies – the relevant technology would be required to access Deep Deposits.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

The Russian technology had proven reliable and robust, developed around one simple purpose – get the job done. The RC Driller makes no difference, and while it has some flaws, it provides an invaluable option to the ambitious Commander – the ability to rely less on the topography of the Red Planet and the presence of surface Metals deposits.
column3:
The RC Driller is a unique remote-controlled vehicle developed by the Russian Colonization Program. When ordered to exploit an underground Metals or Rare Metals deposit, it deploys its in-built driller probe and starts extracting the valuable resources from deep below.

While doing so it wastes 50% of the production, but on the other hand it grants access to otherwise hard to get resources without the need of operational Dome and the presence of Colonists nearby. The normal logic for accessing an underground deposit applies – the relevant technology would be required to access Deep Deposits.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

The Russian technology had proven reliable and robust, developed around one simple purpose – get the job done. The RC Driller makes no difference, and while it has some flaws, it provides an invaluable option to the ambitious Commander – the ability to rely less on the topography of the Red Planet and the presence of surface Metals deposits.

column2:
RC Harvester is a remote-controlled vehicle tasked with a cargo hold which can pick up and carry resources from and to various storage units across the surface of Mars. It can set up transport routes and maintain the flow of resources between two points of the map. Another function of the RC Harvester is to gather resources from surface deposits of Metals and Polymers.

The unique feature of RC Harvester is the ability to extract Concrete from Concrete Deposits. Ordering the vehicle to the deposit allows it to start sifting through the deposit area, slowly moving and gathering Concrete into its cargo hold. It would stop doing so once its cargo hold has been filled.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Blue Sun Corporation have a singular purpose in mind when they set on colonizing Mars – get rich fast. To the top brass of the Corporation building an expensive and hard to maintain Concrete Extractors early on would slow down the development of profitable mining operation and would pose a risk of losing the space race to another Mission. The stakes were too high and the RC Harvester was quickly pushed through test sequences and added to the arsenal of the determined Commander.

column2:
The RC Generator is a remote-controlled vehicle which can transport and deploy Drones to remote areas if needed. It can also repair any damaged Drones and return them to operational state.

RC Generator is equipped with its own energy source in the form of Solar Panel which, during the day, accumulates Power. If the vehicle is positioned near a power cable, it can act as a Solar Panel, giving its energy production to the given network.

RC Generator is powered by a Solar Panel, installed on the top of its hull. The power produced by this system is enough to charge the capacitors of the rover and can even render this power to a power network if it is placed near a power cable. Just like a regular Solar Panel, the RC Generator would produce power only during the day.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

The ambition of the PRC to colonize Mars and absorb its vast riches into its fold required new instruments. Enter the RC Generator. The robust vehicle was designed with a singular purpose in mind – to provide the life-blood of a quickly growing colony. Its autonomous power capabilities allow it to power large amounts of Drones and quickly create remote, self-sufficient resource operations. The perfect tool for the ambitious Commander, this unique vehicle will allow China to make another Great Leap Forward.

column2:
RC Seeker is a remote-controlled vehicle which can transport and deploy Drones to remote areas if needed. It can also repair any damaged Drones and return them to operational state.

RC Seeker is equipped with a sensor array which is deployed when the vehicle isn't moving. This equipment acts as a Sensor Tower and significantly speeds up the scanning process of nearby sectors of the map and in prediction of incoming disasters.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Mars is full of curiosities and wonders, veiled only by the humans’ inability to notice and understand them. The leaders of the European Space Program firmly believe that the key to making the Red Planet our second home is not in fighting it, but rather understand it and adapt to it. This was the reason they made exploration a paramount. The RC Seeker allows the craft Commander to quickly discover the best places for future expansion and delve into the mysterious scientific discoveries that lie hidden on the surface of the lifeless planet.
column3:
РК Шукальнік is a remote-controlled vehicle which can transport and deploy Drones to remote areas if needed. It can also repair any damaged Drones and return them to operational state.

РК Шукальнік is equipped with a sensor array which is deployed when the vehicle isn't moving. This equipment acts as a Вежа-сканэр and significantly speeds up the scanning process of nearby sectors of the map and in prediction of incoming disasters.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Mars is full of curiosities and wonders, veiled only by the humans’ inability to notice and understand them. The leaders of the European Space Program firmly believe that the key to making the Red Planet our second home is not in fighting it, but rather understand it and adapt to it. This was the reason they made exploration a paramount. The РК Шукальнік allows the craft Commander to quickly discover the best places for future expansion and delve into the mysterious scientific discoveries that lie hidden on the surface of the lifeless planet.

column2:
Jumper Shuttles follow a fast parabolic course over the terrain, traversing great distances in mere moments. They pick up and deliver resources and Colonists around the surface of Mars, wherever needed. When not in use, they are stationed at Jumper Shuttle Hubs, where they are maintained and refueled.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Jumper Shuttles were proven a great advancement for the newly sprouting colonies on Mars, but they became a great hit when the marketing team at Paradox Interactive put on a series of web videos from the cameras in the passenger cockpits with the descriptive name “Colonists React to Jumper Shuttles”.
column3:
Джампер Шатлы follow a fast parabolic course over the terrain, traversing great distances in mere moments. They pick up and deliver resources and Colonists around the surface of Mars, wherever needed. When not in use, they are stationed at ЦК Джампер Шатлаў, where they are maintained and refueled.

<center><image UI/Common/rollover_line.tga 2000> <left>

Джампер Шатлы were proven a great advancement for the newly sprouting colonies on Mars, but they became a great hit when the marketing team at Paradox Interactive put on a series of web videos from the cameras in the passenger cockpits with the descriptive name “Colonists React to Джампер Шатл”.

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Zeus Rocket - increased rocket payload ( kg) - Advanced Stirling Generator - generates power and can protect from Cold Waves - Colonists never get Earthsick - Food supply from Passenger Rockets increased (x10) - Rockets synthesize Fuel - Start with a Self-Sufficient Dome prefab
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Зеўс ракета - павялічаная грузаздольнасьць ракеты ( кг) - Перадавы гэнератар стырлінга - выпрацоўвае энэргію й захоўвае ад Халодных хваль - Каляністы ніколі не Тугуюць па Зямлі - Колькасьць ежы павышана ў пасажырскіх ракетах (x10) - Ракеты сінтэзуюць паліва - Модульны самадастатковы купал на старце

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Zeus Rocket - increased rocket payload ( kg) - Advanced Orbital Probe - scans five sectors - Megamall - service building that satisfies most interests - Periodic additional funding
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Зеўс ракета - павялічаная грузаздольнасьць ракеты ( кг) - Перадавы арбітальны зонд - скануе пяць сэктараў - Мэгагандлёвы цэнтр - сэрвісны будынак, які задавальняе большасьць інтарэсаў - Перыядычнае дафінансаваньне

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - RC Harvester - transporter rover that can harvest concrete from regolith deposits - Corporate Office - employs workers and generates funding - Can buy Applicants with funding - Additional Rockets are significantly cheaper - Probes can discover deep Rare Metal deposits - Bonus Tech: Deep Metal Extraction (can extract deep metals and deep rare metals deposits)
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - РК Камбайн - транспарт, які можа здабываць бэтон з радовішч рэгаліту - Карпаратыўны офіс - наймае работнікаў і стварае фінансаваньне - Можа купіць кандыдатаў за $ - Дадатковыя ракеты значна таньней - Зонды могуць выявіць глыбокія радовішча рэдкіх мэталаў - Бонусная тэхнолёгія: Здабыча глыбокіх мэталаў (можа здабываць глыбокія радовішча мэталаў і рэдкіх мэталаў)

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - RC Generator - RC Commander that can generate power as a solar panel - Tai-chi Garden - small exercising garden, visitors recover small amounts of Health and may become Fit - Passenger Rockets carry 10 additional Colonists - Applicants are generated twice as fast
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - РК Гэнератар - РК Кардынатар, які выпрацоўвае энэргію як сонечная панэль - Тай-чі сад - невялікі трэніровачны сад, наведвальнікі аднаўляюць невялікую колькасьць Здароўя й могуць стаць Падцягнутымі - Пасажырскія ракеты умяшчаюць 10 дадатковых каляністаў - Новая кандыдаты з'яўляюцца ўдвая хутчэй

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - RC Constructor - transporter rover that can construct buildings - Metals Refinery - slowly converts Waste Rock into Metals - All building costs reduced by 20% - Bonus Tech: Low-G Engineering (unlocks Medium Dome)
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - РК Будаўнік - марсаход які можа будаваць будынкі - Апрацоўшчык мэталаў - павольна ператварае пустую пароду ў мэталы - Кошт будынкаў зьніжаны на 20% - Бонусная тэхнолёгія: Інжынэрыя нізкай гравітацыі (разблакуе сярэдні купал)

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - RC Seeker - RC Commander that works as a sensor tower when stationary - Low-G Lab - a research building that is built outside domes and reduces the cost of Biotech and Physics techs - 5 extra starting technologies - Gain Funding every time a tech is researched. Gain double if it's a Breakthrough tech
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - РК Шукальнік - РК Кардынатар які працуе як вежа-сканэр - Лабараторыя нізкай гравітацыі - дасьледчы будынак, які пабудаваны па-за купаламі і зьніжае кошт біётэхнолёгічных і фізычных тэхнолёгій - 5 дадатковых тэхнолёгій у пачатку - Атрымлівае фінансаваньне за кожную дасьледаваную тэхнолёгію. Двайны памер за прарыў

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Dragon Rocket - has smaller cargo capacity () but is faster and requires less fuel - Solar Array - a large cluster of solar panels that have lower maintenance cost but are vulnerable to dust storms - Drone Hubs start with additional Drones - 50% cheaper advanced resources
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Цмок ракета - паньшаная карысная нагрузка (), але яна хутчэй і патрабуе менш паліву - Сонечны масіў - вялікі кластар сонечных панэляў, якія маюць меншы кошт абслугоўваньня, але ўразлівыя да пясчаных бур - ЦК Дронаў маюць дадатковыя Дроны - Перадавыя рэсурсы таньней на 50%

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Large Supply Pod - special supply pod that can carry more cargo - Rare Metals Refinery - turns waste rock into rare metals - Colonists grant funding when they arrive on Mars - Passages cost no resources and are constructed instantly - Colonists suffer no penalties when using passages to work or visit connected domes - 5 free Large Supply Pods
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Вялікая капсула пастаўкі - спецыяльная капсула пастаўкі, якая можа перавозіць больш грузу - ПЗ Рэдкіх мэталаў - ператварае пустую пароду ў рэдкія мэталы - Каляністы даюць фінансаваньне, калі прыбываюць на Марс - Праходы не патрабуюць рэсурсаў і будуюцца імгненна - Каляністы не нясуць ніякіх штрафаў, калі выкарыстоўваюць праходы для працы ці наведваньня злучаных купалаў - 5 дармовых вялікіх капсул паставак

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Ark Pod - a supply pod that can carry passengers - Temple Spire - a service spire that satisfies Social interests and restores Sanity to visitors - All Colonists have the Religious trait - Birthrate is doubled - Hydroponic Farms performance reduced by 50 (drawback)
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Каўчэг капсула - капсула пастаўкі, якая можа перавозіць пасажыраў - Храмавы шпіль - сэрвісны шпіль, што задавальняе сацыяльныя інтарэсы й вяртае розум наведвальнікам - Усе каляністы маюць рэлігійную рысу - Нараджальнасьць падвояна - Вытворчасьць гідрапонных фэрм зьніжана на 50 (заган)

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - RC Driller - a special rover that can extract resources from underground deposits but wastes some of the deposit - Concrete Plant - an automated extractor that produces concrete without the need of a deposit but consumes fuel - Bonus Tech: Fueled Extractors (extractor upgrade that boosts production but consumes Fuel) - Fueled Extractors upgrade is free - Fuel Refinery prefab costs less - Rockets have extended travel time (drawback)
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - РК Сьвідроўшчык - спэцыяльны марсаход, які можа здабываць рэсурсы з падземных радовішчаў, але губляе частку радовішча - Бэтонны завод - аўтаматызаваны экстрактар, які вырабляе бэтон без неабходнасьці радовішчу, але спажывае паліва - Бонусная тэхнолёгія: Запраўлены экстрактар (паляпшэньне экстрактару, якое павялічвае вытворчасьць, але спажывае паліва) - Дармовае паляпшэньне Запраўлены экстрактар - Зборнік заводу паліва каштуе менш на - Ракеты маюць павялічаны час палёту (заган)

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Jumper Shuttle - faster shuttles that use parabolic trajectories - Game Developer - produces games which grant funding depending on their success - Discover more Breakthrough Anomalies - Researching a Breakthrough Tech grants Applicants - Rockets require more fuel to launch (drawback)
column3: Дасьледаваньне ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Джампер Шатл - хуткія шатлы, што выкарыстоўваюць параболічныя траэкторыі - Распрацоўшчык гульняў - вырабляе гульні якія даюць фінансаваньне залежачы ад іх посьпеху - Знаходзіць больш прарыўных анамалій - Дасьледваньне прарыву дае новых кандыдатаў - Ракеты патрабуюць больш паліву для ўзлёту (заган)

column2: Research per Sol: Rare Metals price: $ M - Wasp Drone - faster, flying drone - Automatic Metals Extractor - a Metal Extractor that doesn't require workforce - Rovers - cost and weight lowered by 50% - Exploring a sector grants research points - All specialists perform better (+10 performance) - Applicant generation reduced (drawback)
column3: Дасьледаваньняў ў Сол: Кошт рэдкіх мэталаў: $ Млн. - Дрон-аса - хуткі, лятаюшчы дрон - Аўтаматычны мэталаэкстрактар - мэталаэкстрактар, які не патрабуе працоўнікаў - Марсаходы - кошт і вага зьніжаны на 50% - Выведка сэктараў дае балы дасьледаваньняў - Усе спэцыялісты працуюць лепш (+10 прадукцыйнасьці) - Меньш новых кандыдатаў (заган)

column2: To use a Covert Operation against another colony you will need a fully fuelled Rocket and a crew of Security Officers.<newline><newline>All Covert Ops will lower your Standing with the target colony and have a chance to fail.
column3: Каб пачаць таемную аперацыю супраць іншай калёніі, вам спатрэбіцца цалкам запраўленая ракета й экіпаж афіцэраў бясьпекі.<newline><newline>Усе таемныя аперацыі панізяць вашы аднісіны з накіраванай калёніяй і маюць шанец няўдачы.
column4: Aby wykonywać tajne operacje przeciwko innej kolonii, potrzebujesz w pełni zatankowanej rakiety i załogi złożonej z funkcjonariuszy bezpieczeństwa.<newline><newline>Wszystkie tajne operacje pogorszą nastawienie drugiej strony do ciebie i mogą się nie udać.

column2: Japan's Drone technology is not compatible with ours.
column3: Японская тэхнолёгія дронаў не сумяшчальна з нашай.
column4: Japońska technologia dronów jest niekompatybilna z naszą.

column2: Our Drone technology is not compatible with theirs.
column3: Наша тэхнолёгія дронаў несумяшчальная з іхняю.
column4: Nasza technologia dronów jest niekompatybilna z ich technologią.

column2: Sabotage buildings to delay milestone and Expedition progress<RiskTextSabotage>
column3: Sabotage buildings to delay milestone and Expedition progress<RiskTextSabotage>
column4: Sabotuj budynki, by opóźnić osiągnięcie kamieni milowych i postęp ekspedycji <RiskTextSabotage>

column2: sets back the target, cancels milestone and Expedition progress
column3: sets back the target, cancels milestone and Expedition progress
column4: cofa cel, anuluje postęp ekspedycji i dążenia do kamienia milowego.

column2: Attempt to recruit Colonists without Flaws from the rival Colony.
column3: Паспрабуйце завербаваць каляністаў без заганаў з калёніі супраціўніку.
column4: Próba zwerbowania w rywalizującej kolonii kolonistów bez wad.

column2: But of course! Sending some resources won't put too much weight on our economy.
column3: Але, вядома! Адпраўка некалькі рэсурсаў не пашкодзіць нашай эканоміцы.
column4: Ależ oczywiście! Wysłanie pewnej ilości zasobów nie obciąży zbytnio naszej gospodarki.

column2: Say no more, my friend! We shall immediately provide the help you requested. No effort is too big for an old friend, isn't it?
column3: Не слову больш, мой дружа! Мы неадкладна акажам дапамогу, якую вы запыталі. Ніякія намаганьні не занадта вялікі для старога сябра, ці не так?
column4: Nie musicie mówić nic więcej, przyjaciele! Natychmiast zapewnimy wam pomoc, której potrzebujecie. Dla starych znajomych zrobimy wszystko.

column2: I see – there is an issue you can't handle by yourself. Very well then, we'll send some help.
column3: Бачым – ёсьць праблемы, з якім вам не здоліць самастойна. Добра, тады мы дашлем дапамогу.
column4: Rozumiem, że macie problem, którego nie jesteście w stanie rozwiązać sami. Zgoda, wyślemy wam pomoc.

column2: A Commander with your skills may yet have some trouble from time to time. That's understandable and we'll send help.
column3: Камандыр з вашымі навычкамі можа час ад часу мець праблемы. Гэта зразумела.
column4: Nawet dowódca o twoich talentach może mieć czasem problemy. To zrozumiałe, wyślemy pomoc.

column2: Seriously? How can you believe we would help you, after everything you've done?!
column3: Сур'ёзна? Як вы можаце лічыць, што мы дапаможам вам, пасля ўсяго, што вы зрабілі?!
column4: Poważnie? Jak możecie sądzić, że wam pomożemy – po tym wszystkim, co zrobiliście?!

column2: Hah! I knew you'd come to me crying, but you must be a fool to expect we'd help you.
column3: Ха! Я ведаў, што ты прыйдзеш да мяне плачучы, але ты варта дурань, калі чакаеш, што мы табе дапаможам.
column4: Ha! Wiedzieliśmy, że kiedyś przybiegniecie do nas z płaczem, ale chyba jesteście głupcami, skoro oczekujecie, że wam pomożemy.

column2: Oh, you're in trouble now? Deal with it, happy tree friend.
column3: О, у вас цяпер праблемы? Разбірайся, дарагі сябра.
column4: Ach teraz wy macie kłopoty? Radźcie sobie sami, \„przyjaciele\”.

column2: Ha-ha! Let you fall and we be taking over. All your base are belong to us!
column3: Ха-ха! Няхай вы ўпадзеце, а мы возьмем верх. Уся ваша база належаць нам!
column4: Cha cha! Upadnijcie, a my was przejmiemy. All your base are belong to us!

column2: I'm sorry, we can't really help you at this time. Please consider asking someone else.
column3: Выбачайце, але мы сапраўды не ў стане вам дапамагчы. Калі ласка запытайце другіх.
column4: Przykro nam, ale naprawdę nie możemy wam w tej chwili pomóc. Zwróćcie się może do kogoś innego.

column2: I understand your predicament, but we can't afford to send help at this time.
column3: Я разумею ваша цяжкае становішча, але мы не можам дазволіць сабе адправіць дапамогу ў гэты час.
column4: Rozumiemy waszą ciężką sytuację, ale w tej chwili nie możemy sobie pozwolić na udzielenie wam pomocy.

column2: Good day, Commander. Please make it short, comm time is precious.
column3: Дзень добры, камандыр. Калі ласка, давайце хутка, час на зносіны каштоўны.
column4: Dzień dobry, dowódco. Streszczaj się, proszę, roaming jest kosztowny.

column2: Let me explain this to you once. If I ever kill you, you'll be awake, you'll be facing me, and you'll be armed.
column3: Дазвольце мне паведаць вам гэта адзін раз. Калі я калі-небудзь заб'ю цябе, ты прачнешся, будзеш стаяць тварам да мяне й будзеш узброены.
column4: Pozwól, że coś ci wyjaśnię. Jeśli cię kiedykolwiek zabiję, przyjdę otwarcie, będę walczyć twarzą w twarz i nie zaatakuję bezbronnego przeciwnika.

column2: Oh, it's you. If this is the future, I'd like to live in the past.
column3: Оў, гэта вы. Калі гэта прышлосьць, я бы хацеў застацца ў мінулым.
column4: Ach, to ty. Jeśli to jest przyszłość, wolę żyć w przeszłości.

column2: Seek redemption, poor stray soul, and your sins may be forgiven.
column3: Шукай збавеньне, няшчасная, аблудная душа, і твае грахі могуць быць дараваныя.
column4: Pokutuj, biedna zbłąkana duszyczko, a może twoje grzechy zostaną zapomniane.

column2: What now, you need some help to fill your tax returns or what?
column3: Што цяпер? Вам патрэбна дапамога, каб запоўніць падатковую дэкларацыю ці што?
column4: Co znowu? Potrzebujecie pomocy z wypełnieniem PIT-u?

column2: They say in a democracy one must respect the choice of the people, even though they may be ignorant and misguided. And – here you are!
column3: Як кажуць, у дэмакратыі трэба паважаць выбар людзей, нават калі яны могуць быць недасьведчанымі й памылковымі. І... вось ты!
column4: Powiadają, że w demokracji jednostka musi uszanować wolę ludu, nawet gdy lud jest bandą naiwnych ignorantów. No i proszę, oto się zjawiasz!

column2: Know what, my droog? A Russian babushka would make a better Commander than you.
column3: Ведаеш што, дурань мой? З расейскай бабці быў бы лепшы камандыр за вас.
column4: Wiesz co, dorogoj drug? Rosyjska babuszka byłaby lepszym dowódcą niż ty.

column2: Hi, Commander. You probably have quite a lot of fuel. I think we should bring you some freedom and democracy!
column3: Прывітаньне, камандыр. У вас, напэўна, даволі шмат паліву. Я лічу, мы павінны прынесьці вам волю й дэмакратыю!
column4: Cześć, dowódco. Podobno masz mnóstwo paliwa. Uznaliśmy, że przyniesiemy ci w zamian wolność i demokrację!

column2: Greetings, friend! How can we help you?
column3: Вітаю, дружа! Чым мы можам вам дапамагчы?
column4: Witajcie, przyjaciele! Jak możemy wam pomóc?

column2: Hello dear! Happy to see you. If we can help in any way, just name it!
column3: Прывітаньне дарагі! Рады цябе бачыць. Калі мы можам чымсьці дапамагчы, проста скажыце гэта!
column4: Cześć, kochanie! Miło cię widzieć. Jeśli możemy wam jakoś pomóc, powiedz tylko słowo!

column2: Good morning, Commander! I hope I find you in good health. How can we help?
column3: Добраранак, камандыр! Спадзяюся, вы добра адчуваецце сябе. Як мы можам дапамагчы?
column4: Dzień dobry, dowódco! Mam nadzieję, że zastaję cię w dobrym zdrowiu. Jak możemy pomóc?

column2: Oh, it's you, my friend! I'm glad to see you on screen. How is everything going?
column3: О, гэта ты, дружа! Я рады бачыць цябе на экране. Як справы?
column4: Ach, to wy, przyjaciele! Cieszę się, że was widzę na ekranie. Jak leci?

column2: I used to be an astrogeologist like you, but then I took an asteroid in the sensor tower.
column3: Раней я быў астрагеолагам, як і вы, але потым астэроід прабіў мой вежа-сканэр.
column4: Kiedyś sam byłem astrogeologiem, ale potem oberwałem asteroidą w wieżyczkę detekcyjną.

column2: Ni hao, comrade, let's go party... There's no party like our party!
column3: Ні хао, таварыш, хадзем гуляць... Няма такой гулянкі, як наша!
column4: Ni hao, towarzysze! Partia rządzi, partia radzi, partia nigdy was nie zdradzi!

column2: Hello, Commander! I see you're player too!
column3: Прывітаньне, камандыр! Я бачу, што вы таксама гулец!
column4: Witam, dowódco! Widzę, że też jesteś graczem!

column2: Good morning, Commander! You know, I had a weird dream again last night... Do you think it may be related to a childhood trauma?
column3: Добрай раніцы, камандыр! Ведаеце, мінулай ноччу я зноў сасьніў нешта дзіўнае... Як вы лічаце, гэта можа быць зьвязана зь дзіцячай траўмай?
column4: Dzień dobry, dowódco! Wiesz, ostatniej nocy śniło mi się coś dziwnego... Czy to może być spowodowane jakąś traumą z dzieciństwa?

column2: Hello, Commander. Which one is harder – running a colony or rocket science? You seem to have talent for both.
column3: Прывітанне, камандзір. Што цяжэй - кіраваць калёніяй ці ракетабудаваньне? Здаецца, вы маеце талент да абодвух.
column4: Cześć, dowódco. Co jest trudniejsze – kierowanie kolonią czy kosmonautyka? Ty masz talent do obu tych rzeczy.

column2: Ah, it's you. What trouble are you brewing this time?
column3: А, гэты ты. Якую бяду вы рыхтуеце на гэты раз?
column4: Ach, to ty. Co tam znowu knujesz?

column2: You are a poor excuse of a Commander. How come you're still in power?!
column3: Вы - дрэннае апраўданьне камандыру. Як гэта ты яшчэ пры ўладзе?!
column4: Jesteś popierdółka, a nie dowódca. Jakim cudem utrzymujesz się u władzy?!

column2: Oh, it's you, Commander. I heard you were a City Mayor back on Earth. I often wonder – have they sent you to space in order to save their city, or what?
column3: А, гэта вы, камандыр. Чуў, што вы былі мэрам гораду на Зямлі. Я часта задаюся пытаньнем – вас ў космас адправілі, каб выратаваць свой горад, ці як?
column4: Ach, to ty, dowódco. Podobno na Ziemi zdarzyło ci się być burmistrzem? Często się zastanawiam, czy przypadkiem nie wysłali cię w kosmos, aby ocalić swoje miasto.

column2: Commander. Does your colony flourish already, or you need to hug a few more trees?
column3: Камандыр. Ваша калёнія ўжо квітнее, ці вам трэба абняць яшчэ некалькі дрэў?
column4: Dowódco, czy twoja kolonia już rozkwita, czy też musisz przytulić jeszcze kilka drzew?

column2: Greetings. Listen carefully, for our words are backed with NUCLEAR WEAPONS!
column3: Прывітаньне. Слухайце ўважліва, бо нашы словы падмацоўваюцца ЯДЗЕРНАЙ ЗБРОЯЙ!
column4: Witaj. I słuchaj uważnie, albowiem za naszymi słowami stoi BROŃ JĄDROWA!

column2: Begone, heretic, and do not tempt my anger!
column3: Прэч, ерэтык, і не спакушай майго гневу!
column4: Idź precz, heretyku, i nie prowokuj mego gniewu!

column2: Greetings, Commander. What assistance do you need?
column3: Вітаю, камандыр. Якая дапамога вам патрэбна?
column4: Pozdrowienia, dowódco. Czego sobie od nas życzycie?

column2: Good day, Commander. How is your colony holding up?
column3: Добры дзень, Камандыр. Як ваша калёнія?
column4: Dzień dobry, dowódco. Jak radzi sobie wasza kolonia?

column2: Oh, it's you. If this is the future, I'd like to live in the past.
column3: Оў, гэта вы. Калі гэта прышлосьць, я бы хацеў застацца ў мінулым.
column4: Ach, to ty. Jeśli to jest przyszłość, wolę żyć w przeszłości.

column2: Hello, is this planet Earth? Oh, it's you, Commander.
column3: Прывітанне, гэта плянета Зямля? А, гэта вы, камандыр.
column4: Halo, czy to Ziemia? Ach, to ty, dowódco.

column2: Greetings, Commander. Oh, one of those disturbing drones of yours is behind your back, watching me as if it tracks my every move. Can you put it away, please?
column3: Вітаю, камандыр. О, адзін з гэтых вашых турбуюшчых дронаў знаходзіцца за тваёй сьпіной і назірае за мной, нібы адсочваючы кожны мой рух. Вы можаце прыбраць яго, калі ласка?
column4: Pozdrowienia, dowódco. Ach, za twoimi plecami kryje się jeden z waszych dziwacznych dronów i obserwuje każdy mój ruch. Czy możesz go gdzieś odesłać?

column2: Hello, Commander. How are things going in your colony? Do you want us to sell you not-a-flamethrower already?
column3: Прывітаньне, камандыр. Як справы вашай калёніі? Можа хочаце каб не-агнямёт ужо прадалі?
column4: Cześć, dowódco. Jak idą sprawy w waszej kolonii? Czy chcecie może, żebyśmy sprzedali wam coś, co nie jest miotaczem ognia?

column2: Thank you! We really appreciate the help.
column3: Дзякуй! Мы вельмі ўдзячныя за дапамогу.

column2: Thank you! We'll put your gift to good use!
column3: Дзякуй! Мы не замарнуем ваш падарунак!
column4: Dziękujemy! Zrobimy dobry użytek z waszego daru!

column2: Well, maybe you're not as bad as I thought.
column3: Бадай вы не такія дрэнныя, як я думаў.
column4: Cóż, może nie jesteście tacy źli, jak sądziliśmy.

column2: We appreciate your intents, but we don't need your help.
column3: Мы цэнім вашыя намеры, але нам не патрэбна ваша дапамога.
column4: Doceniamy wasze dobre chęci, ale nie potrzebujemy waszej pomocy.

column2: I am grateful for your proposal, but maybe not this time. After all, our colony provides everything we need.
column3: Я ўдзячны вашай прапаное, але, бадай, не ў гэты раз. Бо наша калёнія забясьпечана ўсім неабходным.
column4: Jesteśmy wdzięczni za waszą propozycję, ale może nie tym razem. Nasza kolonia dostarcza nam wszystkiego, czego nam trzeba.

column2: I see through your motives. Keep your presents to yourself.\n\nTimeo Danaos et dona ferentes...
column3: Я бачу твае матывы. Пакіньце свае падарункі сабе.\n\nЯ баюся Данайцаў і тых, хто нясе дары......
column4: Wasze zamiary są oczywiste. Zatrzymajcie sobie swoje prezenty.\n\nTimeo Danaos et dona ferentes...

column2: Yes, I believe our colonies will benefit from trading as long as you find our terms satisfactory.
column3: Так, я лічу, што нашы калёніі выйграюць ад гандлю, пакуль вы лічыце нашы ўмовы здавальняючымі.
column4: Tak, sądzę, że obie nasze kolonie odniosą korzyść z handlu, jeśli tylko uznacie nasze warunki za odpowiednie.

column2: We appreciate your offer, but we have no interest in trading right now.
column3: Мы цэнім вашу прапанову, але зараз мы не зацікаўлены ў гандлі.
column4: Doceniamy waszą propozycję, ale w tej chwili nie jesteśmy zainteresowani handlem.

column2: In the light of recent events, I don't believe we have mutual interest in trading.
column3: Гледзячы на апошнія падзеі, я не веру, што мы маем узаемную зацікаўленасьць у гандлі.
column4: W świetle ostatnich wydarzeń nie sądzę, abyśmy podzielali wasze zainteresowanie handlem.

column2: You, filthy by-product of a fungal farm! I wouldn't visit your stinkin' colony even wearing a space suit!
column3: Ты, брудны пабочны прадукт грыбковай фэрмы! Я б не наведаў вашу сьмярдзючую калёнію нават у скафандры!
column4: Ty brudny odpadzie z farmy grzybów! Nie odwiedziłbym waszej cuchnącej kolonii nawet w skafandrze kosmicznym!

column2: You, drone-brained produce of a faulty assembler, why don't you go bother someone of your own IQ?!
column3: Ты, трутнёвы прадукт няспраўнага зборшчыку, чаму б табе не патурбаваць каго-небудзь з тваім жа IQ?!
column4: Ty dronomózgi rupieciu z zepsutej montażowni! Może pójdziesz zawracać głowę komuś, kto ma tak samo niski IQ?!

column2: Have you been hit by a wind turbine on the head, or there just isn't enough Oxygen production in your colony?!
column3: Вас ударыла ветрагенератарам па галаве, ці проста ў вашай калёніі не хапае тлёну?!
column4: Czy może uderzyło cię w głowę spadające śmigło turbiny wiatrowej, czy też w waszej kolonii jest za mało tlenu?!

column2: What is wrong with you?! What have we done to deserve this?
column3: Што ня так з табой?! Што мы зрабілі, каб заслужыць гэта?
column4: Co z wami jest?! Czym sobie na to zasłużyliśmy?

column2: How dare you? Mind your language, or I'll make you regret this.
column3: Як ты смееш? Сачы што гаманіш, інакш я прымусю вас пашкадаваць аб гэтым.
column4: Jak śmiesz? Licz się ze słowami, bo pożałujesz.

column2: Can you also spare some shuttles?
column3: Ці можаце вы таксама даць некалькі шатлаў?
column4: Czy macie też na zbyciu jakieś wahadłowce?

column2: -25 Standing, aid Rocket is on the way, get 2 Shuttle Hub prefabs
column3: -25 Адносін, Ракета з дапамогаў у пуці, атрымайце 2 модулі ЦК Шатлаў
column4: –25 do nastawienia, rakieta z pomocą jest w drodze, otrzymujesz 2 prefabrykaty węzła wahadłowców.

column2: -20 Standing, aid Rocket is on the way
column3: -20 Адносін, Ракета з дапамогаў у пуці
column4: –20 do nastawienia, rakieta z pomocą jest w drodze.

column2: send resources with a Rocket, gain Standing
column3: адпраўце рэсурсы ракетай, атрымайце паляпшэньне адносін
column4: wyślij zasoby rakietą, a poprawisz ich nastawienie.
poproś o zasoby, nastawienie drugiej strony pogorszy się.

column2: lose Standing with the target Colony, gain Standing with other Colonies
column3: пагубленьне адносін з калёніяй, палепшэньне адносін з другімі калёніямі
column4: nastawienie tej kolonii pogorszy się, ale nastawienie pozostałych kolonii poprawi się.

column2: We will send you the gift as soon as possible.
column3: Мы адправім вам падарунак як мага хутчэй.
column4: Wyślemy wam prezent, gdy tylko to będzie możliwe.
+20 do nastawienia, wyślij rakietę z pomocą

column2: We will provide medical expertise instead.
column3: Замест гэтага мы забясьпечым вам медыцынскую экспертызу.
column4: Zamiast tego zapewnimy wam pomoc medyczną.

column2: We are always eager to help our fellow Martians!
column3: Мы заўсёды імкнемся дапамагчы нашым марсіянам!
column4: Zawsze chętnie pomagamy innym mieszkańcom Marsa!
+40 do nastawienia, wyślij rakietę z pomocą

column2: You will accept <concrete(50000)>  and you will like it!
column3: Вы прымеце <concrete(50000)> і вам гэта спадабаецца!
column4: Otrzymacie <concrete(50000)> i ucieszycie się z tego!
+40 do nastawienia, wyślij rakietę z pomocą
+20 Standing with all other Rival Colonies
+10 Standing with all other Rival Colonies

column2: We will exchange <tech_player> for <tech_ai> with you.
Let's do this some other time.
column3: Давайце зробім гэта ў другі раз.

column2: We will provide medical expertise instead.
column3: Замест гэтага мы забясьпечым вам медыцынскую экспертызу.
column4: Zamiast tego zapewnimy wam pomoc medyczną.

column2: There is much potential in your idea, my friend.
column3: У вашай ідэі вялікі патэнцыял, мой сябар.
column4: W waszym pomyśle kryje się dużo możliwości, przyjaciele.

column2: Perfect time to test my newest gizmo, the "Pied Piper".
column3: Ідэальны час, каб праверыць маю найноўшую штучку, "Крысола".
column4: To idealna chwila na przetestowanie mojego najnowszego ustrojstwa, „Szczurołapa”.

column2: Should we task <number> Security Officers to fly to the rival colony and steal some of their Drones?
column3: Ці павінны мы загацаць <number> афіцэрам паляцець да калёніі супраціўніку й выкрасьці некалькі іх дронаў?
column4: Czy wyślemy <number> funkcjonariuszy bezpieczeństwa do rywalizującej kolonii, aby wykradli kilka dronów?

column2: Should we task <number> Security Officers to fly to the rival colony and try to steal technological advances?
column3: Ці павінны мы загацаць <number> афіцэрам паляцець да калёніі супраціўніку й паспрабаваць выкрасьці перадавыя тэхнолёгіі?
column4: Czy wyślemy <number> funkcjonariuszy bezpieczeństwa do rywalizującej kolonii, aby spróbowali wykraść wiedzę o technologiach?

column2: Should we task <number> Security Officers to fly to the rival colony and try to recruit colonists?
column3: Ці павінны мы загацаць <number> афіцэрам паляцець да калёніі супраціўніку й паспрабаваць завярбаваць каляністаў?
column4: Czy wyślemy <number> funkcjonariuszy bezpieczeństwa do rywalizującej kolonii, aby spróbowali werbować kolonistów?

column2: Should we task <number> Security Officers to fly to the rival colony and sabotage strategic buildings there?
column3: Ці павінны мы загацаць <number> афіцэрам паляцець да калёніі супраціўніку й зрабіць дыверсыю іх стратэгічных будынкаў?
column4: Czy wyślemy <number> funkcjonariuszy bezpieczeństwa do rywalizującej kolonii, aby sabotowali strategiczne budynki?

column2: What a glorious idea, Commander! I think that exchanging research papers will bring many benefits to our colonies.
column3: What a glorious idea, Commander! I think that exchanging research papers will bring many benefits to our colonies.
column4: Cóż za wspaniały pomysł, dowódco! Sądzę, że wymiana artykułów naukowych przyniesie obu naszym koloniom wiele korzyści.

column2: Sounds reasonable, commander. All those eggheads from both colonies will be jolly happy to work together.
column3: Sounds reasonable, commander. All those eggheads from both colonies will be jolly happy to work together.
column4: To brzmi całkiem rozsądnie, dowódco. Jajogłowi z obu naszych kolonii ucieszą się z możliwości współpracy.

column2: We would never share our secrets with treacherous scum like you!
column3: We would never share our secrets with treacherous scum like you!
column4: Nigdy nie podzielimy się naszymi sekretami z takimi plugawymi zdrajcami!

column2: I don't believe we know each other enough for such a serious step in our relationship. Perhaps we will get there, some day.
column3: Я ня лічу, што мы дастаткова ведаем адзін аднаго, каб зрабіць такі сур'ёзны крок у нашых адносінах. Магчыма, аднойчы, але ня зараз.
column4: Sądzę, że znamy się trochę za mało, by podejmować tak poważny krok w naszych kontaktach. Może pewnego dnia znajdziemy się w lepszych stosunkach.

column2: We may not have put so much effort in research like you and we have no technologies to offer. There are more important things in life than science!
column3: We may not have put so much effort in research like you and we have no technologies to offer. There are more important things in life than science!
column4: Chyba nie poświęcamy badaniom naukowym tyle wysiłki, co wy, i nie mamy żadnych technologii do zaoferowania. W życiu są rzeczy ważniejsze od nauki!

column2: I'm sorry, but your current research achievements are of no interest for us.
column3: Выбачце, але вышыя дасягненьні ў дасьледаваньнях заразь не інтэрасуюць нас.
column4: Przykro mi, ale wasze osiągnięcia naukowe nas w tej chwili nie interesują.

column2: <rival_colony> is no longer offering <resource(number2, res2)> for <resource(number1, res1)>
column3: <rival_colony> больш не прапануе <resource(number2, res2)> за <resource(number1, res1)>
column4: Kolonia <rival_colony> nie oferuje już wymiany zasobów (<resource(number2, res2)> za <resource(number1, res1)>).

column2: <rival_name> will scan a Planetary Anomaly in <countdown>

column2: Unparalleled technological superiority entangled with a deep understanding of Nature – and ultimately mastery over it – has always been the great nation of Japan’s ambition. column2: Commander, your name will top the lists of humanity’s heroes for ages – probably forever. We salute you!
column3: Commander, your name will top the lists of humanity’s heroes for ages – probably forever. We salute you!

column2: Commander, thanks to your efforts Thanks to your efforts Blue Sun Corporation has ensured humankind that Mars is truly the new frontier, and that we are the key-holders to the new future of humankind. Continue to achieve our goals and we will make sure that the rewards you have received so far would seem like nothing compared to what’s to come! Mission Sponsor: Commander Profile: Total Score:

column2: Dear shareholders, dear board directors! Let’s applaud the Commander, whose name has become a guarantee for reliability, ambition and prosperity! A person who made our shared goals of profit and growth a paramount!
column3: Dear shareholders, dear board directors! Let’s applaud the Commander, whose name has become a guarantee for reliability, ambition and prosperity! A person who made our shared goals of profit and growth a paramount!
column4: Drodzy udziałowcy, szanowna rado nadzorcza! Bijmy brawo dowódcy, którego imię stało się gwarancją niezawodności, ambicji i powodzenia! Osobie, dla której nasze docelowe zyski i stopy wzrostu były najważniejsze!

column2: Our traditions combined with our commitment to change and innovate have always been the guarantee for the success of building a prosperous society, both on Earth and now on the Red Planet. The world beholds the wonders we have built with awe and appreciation so we realize our responsibility to create a diverse, open and inclusive future for everyone. This is why you should never stop here and pursue more goals, always striving for perfection. Always remember – you have the eyes of the Party and the World at you, Commander! Mission Sponsor: Commander Profile: Total Score:

column2: You, Commander, remained true to our original aspiration and succeeded in securing a decisive victory for the entire humankind, with China as its vanguard. We congratulate you!
column3: You, Commander, remained true to our original aspiration and succeeded in securing a decisive victory for the entire humankind, with China as its vanguard. We congratulate you!
column4: Jesteś wierny naszemu pierwotnemu zamiarowi, dowódco. Udało ci się osiągnąć zdecydowane zwycięstwo dla całej ludzkości, której awangardą są Chiny. Gratulujemy ci!

column2: You have demonstrated an enviable skill and potential for overcoming any challenge Mars has to offer. column2: Congratulations, Commander! Our people look upon you as a herald of new age of prosperity, marked by the colonization of the Red Planet!
column3: Congratulations, Commander! Our people look upon you as a herald of new age of prosperity, marked by the colonization of the Red Planet!
column4: Gratulacje, dowódco! Nasi ludzie postrzegają cię jako zwiastuna nowej ery powodzenia, której początkiem jest kolonizacja Czerwonej Planety!

column2: Your heroic deeds on Mars lit a path for all humankind to follow. The Church ordered you to achieve a set of difficult tasks and you were not found wanting. You, and your brave Colonists, have set an inspiring example for people on Earth, who now flock under the wings of the Church to be led out of the cradle of the homeworld and among the stars. Rejoice, Commander, for Mars offers many more challenges for the one who is led by the burning faith and the desire to constantly prove in the eyes of the Creator. Mission Sponsor: Commander Profile: Total Score:

column2: Humanity has reached far, surviving the dark ages of ignorance through the guidance of the prophets of enlightenment. You, Commander, are truly one of those individuals, touched by the divine spark, whose example shines like a torch for all of us.
column3: Humanity has reached far, surviving the dark ages of ignorance through the guidance of the prophets of enlightenment. You, Commander, are truly one of those individuals, touched by the divine spark, whose example shines like a torch for all of us.
column4: Ludzkość zaszła daleko i przetrwała mroczne wieki ignorancji dzięki przewodnictwu proroków oświecenia. Ty, dowódco, zaiste należysz do ich grona, kręgu tkniętego iskrą Bożą, świecącego przykładem dla nas wszystkich niczym pochodnia w ciemnościach.

column2: You proved to be a modern-day hero of the Russian nation, displaying the valor and resolve so common for our great people! Under your rule the Russian colony on the Red Planet expanded and proved that the ambitions of our people are not to be taken lightly! Yet there is way more to be done on Mars, new goals and new challenges await the one who believes there’s more to be improved! Mission Sponsor: Commander Profile: Total Score:
